title: Software Developer
company: Piab - A brand by Piab Group
description:
**Position:** 
 Software Developer – Application Engineering (Intern)
 



**Location:** 
 Sweden, Danderyd
 



**Department:** 
 Application Engineering
 



**Type:** 
 Internship (Fixed-Term)
 



**About Piab Group:** 




 At Piab Group we improve our customers' productivity, sustainability, and safety through evolving industrial automation and have done so since 1951. We believe in an automated world where no resources are wasted, and no humans are injured. With annual sales of ~3 billion SEK and more than 1400 employees, Piab is a global organization, serving customers in more than 100 countries from a vast network of subsidiaries and channel partners. Since 2018, Piab Group has been owned by Patricia Industries, part of Investor AB.
 



 Piab serves a wide range of industries, including e-commerce logistics, food and beverage, pharmaceuticals, and automotive, providing innovative vacuum automation solutions tailored to each sector.
 



**You can expect the following with us:** 



* **Innovative Culture:** 
 Be part of a team that thrives on creativity and innovation.
* **Global Impact:** 
 Work with a company that is a world leader in vacuum transport solutions.
* **Global Presence:** 
 Piab has 25+ sales offices and over 900 partners worldwide, ensuring a vast network and global reach.
* **Sustainable Vision:** 
 Contribute to an automated world, promoting safety and efficiency.
* **Professional Growth:** 
 Access opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement.
* **Diverse and Inclusive:** 
 Join a workplace that values diversity and fosters an inclusive environment.
* **Stable Employer:** 
 As part of Patricia Industries and connected to the Wallenberg family, Piab benefits from strong support and a commitment to long-term growth and sustainability.



  





**Job Mission:** 




 A growing trend in industrial automation is putting more computing and analytics in the edge – the interface between control system and product. Piab is leading the way with the piCOMPACT®SMART product line and several other products under development. To make full use of these technologies, our application engineering department develops industry-leading software. The objective of a software developer in this department is to help build these tools in a sustainable and flexible manner.
 



  





**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:** 



* Collaborate with the application engineering team to develop tools and software for cutting-edge industrial automation products.
* Contribute to sustainable and flexible software solutions used at the edge of control systems.
* Assist in the design, development, testing, and documentation of applications.
* Work closely with engineers to integrate advanced analytics and control functions in our product line.
* Participate in agile development processes and code reviews.



  





**REQUIREMENTS:** 



* Experience with software engineering, including object-oriented programming (OOP) and software design patterns.
* Proficient in Python (including Poetry and Flask), SQL, JSON, MQTT, and version control systems (e.g., Git).
* Familiarity with communication protocols such as Bluetooth (Low Energy), serial communication, (Industrial) Ethernet, and NFC.
* Verbal and written proficiency in English.
* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in computer science, engineering, or a related technical field.



  





**This is what our employees say about us:** 




 "At Piab, I have the chance to leave my own footprint. The low hierarchy means my ideas are heard and valued. #LoveWhereIWork"
 



  





**How to Apply:** 




 If you are passionate about innovation and want to make a difference in the world of automation, we would love to hear from you! Use the following link to upload your CV.
 



 Please be advised that a valid work permit for the country we offer the open vacancy in is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit cannot be considered.

title: Node.js-utvecklare - Castra
description:
*Vi utmanar de traditionella konsultbolagen och vi kan med stolthet säga att Castra är konsultbranschens mest utvecklande arbetsplats där allt är möjligt. Känns det här som företaget för dig så läs gärna vidare.*
**Rollen**
 Är du en skicklig Node.js-utvecklare som gillar att bygga smarta, snabba och robusta system? Hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att utveckla lösningar som både gör skillnad för våra kunder och som håller i längden. Vi söker dig som brinner för fullstack-utveckling och som vill jobba i en miljö där teknik, samarbete och påverkan står i centrum.
   

  

 Vi har ett kreativt och öppet arbetsklimat där du som konsult får vara med och påverka. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta med varierande projekt hos spännande kunder inom både den privata och offentliga sektorn.
   

  

**Erfarenhet**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av Node.js.
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av andra programmeringsspråk som java, python eller likande samt JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Kunskap om att bygga och integrera REST API:er.
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som AWS, Azure eller GCP är starkt meriterande.


**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.
   

  

**Om Castra**
 Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systesutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.
   

  

 Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring föetagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.
   

  

 Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Annelie.nilsson@castra.se Tel: +46 76-531 45 81

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**Paf stands out from other gaming companies in the market – and not just because of what we do, but
 *why* 
 we do it.** 
 Founded by the Red Cross, Save the Children, Public Health on Åland, and the foundation Dagens Barn, our mission from day one has been to generate funds for the benefit of society.
 



  





 We’re proud to be an award-winning industry leader in responsible gaming – raising the bar and setting new standards that put players first. All our profit goes to charity, and we strive for a long-term sustainable business that care about our employees, customers, and society at large.
 



 Now, we’re looking for a skilled
 **Senior Frontend Developer** 
 to strengthen our growing frontend team.
 



  





**THE TEAM & ROLE** 




 You’ll join a talented and skilled team, known for their collaborative mindset and passion for high-quality code. The team values clean architecture, thoughtful problem-solving, and open knowledge sharing - everyone contributes, and everyone’s voice matters.
 



 The team is responsible for the whole stack from Cloudflare, through React applications and API servers (Backend For Frontend), down to the infrastructure in AWS.
 



 In this role, you’ll work across the entire development lifecycle - from idea and planning to implementation, deployment, and continuous improvement.
 



  





**YOUR PROFILE** 




 You are curious, driven, and love building great user experiences. You take initiative but are also a strong team player who communicates clearly and asks for help when needed.
 



**We believe you have:** 



* 5+ years of experience working with React
* Professional experience with TypeScript



**Bonus if you also bring:** 



* API design skills with GraphQL and REST
* Experience with headless CMS (like Sanity)
* Familiarity with Redis or similar technologies
* Hands-on cloud experience, especially with AWS



 WE OFFER
 


* A company with steady, purposeful growth since 1966
* A workplace that values creativity, autonomy, and wellbeing
* Generous remote work options and support for your home setup
* Occupational healthcare and insurance
* A culture that prioritizes long-term success over short-term stress - overtime is something rare at Paf.



  





**WORK SETUP** 




**In Sweden** 
 : Choose your working location - 100% remote, hybrid, or office-based. Offices in Stockholm and Norrköping.
 



**In Mariehamn (Åland Islands)** 
 : Hybrid/remote, with 3 days per week in our beautiful, modern HQ. Enjoy weekly breakfasts, seminars, massage, an office gym, and more.
 



  





**PRACTICAL INFO** 




**Start** 
 : As soon as possible, depending on notice perio
 



**Type** 
 : Full-time, permanent with a 6-month probation period
 



**Location** 
 : Sweden or Mariehamn
 



**Application** 
 : Via our web form only (GDPR compliance)
 



**Recruitment Process** 
 : Includes a programming assignment, followed by tech interviews and a meeting with the hiring manager
 



 We review applications continuously and close the process as soon as we’ve found the right person.

title: Software Engineer (Scala), Remote
description:
Everything we do is powered by our customers! Featured on Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 list and G2's leaderboard, Maropost offers a connected experience that our customers anticipate, transforming marketing, merchandising, and operations with commerce tools designed to scale with fast-growing businesses. With a relentless focus on our customers’ success, we are motivated by curiosity, creativity, and collaboration to power 5,000+ global brands.
   

  

 Driven by a customer-first mentality, we empower businesses to achieve their goals and grow alongside us. If you're ready to make a significant impact and be part of our transformative journey, Maropost is the place for you.
   

  

 Become a part of Maropost today and help shape the future of commerce!
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are looking for an open-minded and enthusiastic intermediate-level Scala Engineer to join our backend team. We are a passionate and highly collaborative team with a bias for quality and continuous improvement. If you are looking for an environment where you can learn and see your ideas come to life, let's talk!
   

  

 The role will be based in Europe. Core working hours for this role are 9:00am-5:00pm CET (+/- 2 hours).
   

  

**What You'll Be Responsible For**
* Design and write sustainable, easy-to-read, and elegant code, rearchitecting and refactoring existing software where needed.
* Contributing to technical and product specs, and collaborating on architecture and design decisions together with the other stakeholders
* Testing the software you build for reliability and robustness using different testing paradigms and libraries
* Review feedback on the specs and the code as an opportunity for continuous improvement and collaborative design, and carrying out spec and code review for your coworkers
* Make recommendations regarding introducing new tools and improving processes.
* Continuous learning of different programming paradigms and new technologies
* Work with a highly collaborative group of engineers.


**What You'll Bring To Maropost**
* 3+ years of experience in Scala.
* 2+ years' experience with mapping business domains into SQL schemas.
* Experience with message-based architectures (we use Pulsar).
* Knowledge in API design (REST or GraphQL).
* Understand and work with modern cloud-native infrastructure (we deploy to Kubernetes).
* Responsible for builds and CI/CD processes (we use CircleCI for builds and GitOps with ArgoCD for back-end deployments).
* Excellent communication skills, a bias for feedback and continuous improvement, combined with the ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
* The ability to take ownership and initiatives over tasks/projects and share any new ideas with the team.


 What’s in it for you?
   

  

 You will have the autonomy to take ownership of your role and contribute to the growth and success of our brand. If you are driven to make an immediate impact, achieve results, thrive in a high performing team and want to grow in a dynamic and rewarding environment – You belong to Maropost!

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
**Lead .NET Developer Opportunity in Non-Profit Organization** 




  





 I am looking for a Lead .NET Developer to join a Non-Profit organisation focusing on sustainability and social improvement
 



  





 As a Lead Developer, you would coordinating a team of 7-8 developers and leading technical work. Your primary focus will be supporting your team, however you will still be hands on with the product.
 



  





 This is a great time to join as they have some really big initiatives and projects coming up, relating to upgrading and changing to newer tech.
 



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* 5+ years' experience with .NET, ideally .NET 6 or above.
* Strong Azure experience
* Strong SQL experience
* Experience leading a team or scrum.



  





**It is beneficial to have worked with:** 




  




* EpiServer/Optimizely
* SAP
* Salesforce



  





*This role requires candidates to speak Fluent Swedish and is unable to support Visas.* 




  





 Salary based on experience, hybrid working, strong benefits package.
 



  





**This is a short description of the role. For more information, please apply and I will be in touch.**

title: Java Developer
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet** 




 Dun & Bradstreet unlocks the power of data through analytics, creating a better tomorrow. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture and accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our 6,000+ global team members are passionate about what we do. We are dedicated to helping clients turn uncertainty into confidence, risk into opportunity and potential into prosperity. Bold and diverse thinkers are always welcome. Come join us!
 



  





**The role:** 




 We are looking for an experienced Java Developer to join our team in Sweden. We maintain and develop several business-critical applications built on Java, .NET, and SQL Server. As we move toward a unified, modern architecture in Java and AWS, we need a help to drive technical improvements, support the team, and promote best practices in software development and agile collaboration.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Hands-On Development** 
 : Design, build, and refactor systems into containerized microservices running in cloud.
* **Handle critical maintenance & support in both modern and legacy** 
 : Handle incidents in production systems with technical investigations and solutions.
* **Drive Modernization** 
 : Contribute to the strategy and execution of transforming legacy applications into modern cloud solutions.
* **Support the Team** 
 : Share knowledge, promote modern software development practices, and encourage team collaboration.
* **Advocate for Best Practices** 
 : Implement clean code principles, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker).



  





**Who You Are:** 



* Around 5 years of experience with Java and microservices development.
* Exposure to legacy systems (e.g., .NET and relational databases like SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB).
* Proficiency with Docker and experience building containerized applications.
* Familiarity with Spring Boot framework and AWS cloud services.
* Well-oriented and comfortable working on Linux on-prem servers.



  





**Team and Collaboration** 
 :
 


* Ability to work effectively in a team environment, sharing knowledge and supporting colleagues.
* Experience working with agile processes and a collaborative mindset.



  





**Mindset** 
 :
 


* Passion for system modernization, solving technical challenges and improving processes.
* Willingness to bridge the gap between legacy systems and modern software solutions.



  




* Fluent in both
 **English and Swedish** 
 language.



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 At Dun & Bradstreet, we’re more than just data and analytics. We’re building a workplace where diverse ideas flourish, personal development is prioritized, and every team member is empowered to make a difference.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Role: Power BI Developer
 



 Location: Stockholm, Sweden - Hybrid
 



 Employment Type: B2B Contract and Permanent
 



 Notice period: Immediate – 2 Weeks
 



 Rate : 200 -250 Euros/Day
 



**Responsibilities and Duties:**








**Primary Responsibilities:** 




 1. Design, develop, and deploy Power BI reports and dashboards.
 



 2. Extract and transform data from ServiceNow to Power BI.
 



 3. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure reports meet business needs.
 



 4. Optimize Power BI dashboards with a focus on usability and performance.
 



 5. Maintain and update existing Power BI reports as needed.
 



 6. Provide training and support to end-users on Power BI functionalities.
 







**Required Qualifications:** 




 1. Proven experience with Power BI and ServiceNow.
 



 2. Strong understanding of data modeling, data transformation, and DAX.
 



 3. Experience in creating complex reports and dashboards in Power BI.
 



 4. Proficiency in SQL and data extraction techniques.
 



 5. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
 







**Preferred Qualifications:** 




 1. Experience in the specific industry of the employer.
 



 2. Familiarity with other data visualization tools.
 



 3. Knowledge of ServiceNow modules and functionalities.
 



 4. Certification in Power BI or related technologies.
 







**Skill & Competencies:** 




 1. Strong communication and collaboration skills.
 



 2. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
 



 3. Attention to detail and a strong focus on quality.
 



 4. Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
Kundo är ett SaaS-bolag som erbjuder Sveriges främsta kundservice­system för alla digitala kanaler. Kundservice är en bransch i snabb förändring där AI har medfört stora möjligheter till effektivisering. Det innebär att vi har en ambitiös och spännande resa framför oss där vi fortsätter att bygga ut vår produkt och skapa en plattform som stöttar innovation.
 



 På vår fortsatta tillväxtresa letar vi efter dig som vill ansluta till vårt fantastiska utvecklingsteam som Senior Frontend Developer.
 



 Som utvecklare hos oss ingår du i ett av våra tvärfunktionella team där ni tar gemensamt ägande för hela tech stacken. Huvudfokus i teamen är att utveckla och vidareutveckla våra tjänster. I tätt samarbete med andra roller som product managers, designers, AI engineers etc arbetar du i hela flödet från att identifiera våra kunders behov, välja bästa väg framåt och implementera en lösning, samt inte minst att följa upp och förbättra den över tid.
 



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig** 




 För att trivas i rollen här har du antagligen dessa egenskaper:
 


* Minst 5 år erfarenhet av frontendutveckling
* Djupa kunskaper i HTML, CSS och JavaScript
* Gedigen erfarenhet av React och Typescript
* Kunskap om WCAG och hur man bygger gränssnitt med hög tillgänglighet
* Grundläggande erfarenhet och förståelse för backendutveckling och arkitektur



  





 Du är en nyfiken och ansvarstagande lagspelare som gärna testar nya tillvägagångssätt och tycker om att jobba kundnära. Du gillar produktutveckling och är van att bidra i tidiga faser med fokus på innovation. Du är van vid att leda dig själv och räds inte att ta egna initiativ.
 



  





  





**Om vår produkt** 




 Med vår produkt får våra kunder ett modernt och kraftfullt kundserviceverktyg att samarbeta i för att svara på alla ärenden som de får in. Med hjälp av vår produkt levererar organisationer i Norden en bättre kundserviceupplevelse till tiotusentals kunder varje dag. Flera miljoner meddelanden passerar genom våra system varje månad - och den siffran ökar hela tiden.
 



 Enkelheten i att använda våra tjänster är mycket uppskattat av våra kunder och något vi är stolta över.
 



  





 Undrar du vilka tekniker vi arbetar med? Här är de tekniker du kommer att arbeta med:
 


* TypeScript
* React
* Sass
* Python / Django
* Github
* Kubernetes
* AWS



  





 Har du några frågor? Vi berättar gärna mer! Hör av dig till Jonatan Larsson på 070-5124424 eller jonatan@kundo.se. Till rekryteringsbyråer: vi har samarbetpartner klar för denna roll.

title: Fullstack Developer AI/Data - [F/M/X]
description:
Who are we?
   

  

**Amaris Consulting** 
 is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.
   

  

 At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
   

  

**Brief Call** 
 : Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
   

  

**Interviews** 
 (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
   

  

**Case study** 
 : Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
   

  

 As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
   

  

 We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Job Description**
**About the Role:**
 We're looking for a versatile
 **Fullstack Developer** 
 to build and maintain applications that integrate AI and data solutions. You'll work across the entire stack to create intuitive interfaces and robust backend systems that power our data-driven products.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop frontend applications using modern frameworks (React, Angular, or Vue.js)
* Build and maintain backend services (Node.js, Python, Java, or .NET)
* Design and implement APIs (REST, GraphQL) for AI/data integration
* Create data visualization interfaces for complex datasets
* Implement CI/CD pipelines and automated testing
* Collaborate with AI/ML teams to integrate models into production


**Technical Requirements:**
* 3+ years of fullstack development experience
* Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript and at least one backend language
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
* Knowledge of database systems (SQL and NoSQL)
* Understanding of containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)


**Soft Skills:**
* Strong problem-solving abilities
* Excellent communication skills
* Adaptable and quick learner


**Nice-to-Have:**
* Experience with AI/ML integration
* Knowledge of data visualization libraries (D3.js, Chart.js)
* Familiarity with microservices architecture


***Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.***

title: Embedded Software Engineer
job_function: Information Technology, Product Management, and Manufacturing
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Motor Vehicle Manufacturing
description:
**Rollen som Embedded Software Application Engineer på Öhlins** 




  





 Öhlins är ett världsledande företag som tänjer på gränserna för fjädringsteknik – och på mekatronikavdelningen utvecklas semi-aktiva fjädringssystem till världens ledande motorcykel- och biltillverkare.
 



  





 Som Embedded Software Application Engineer får du en nyckelroll i att ta fram kundspecifika lösningar för avancerade, elektroniskt styrda fjädringssystem som förenar mekanik, elektronik och mjukvara.
 



  





 Som applikationsutvecklare får du arbeta nära Öhlins kunder och jobba med hela processen från kravhantering, design och implementation av kundspecifik mjukvara till enhets-, system- och fordonstester.
 



  





 På Öhlins kommer du att vara en del av ett scrumteam där du är med och planerar ditt eget och teamets arbete enligt agil metodik. I nära samarbete med tvärfunktionella team och globala OEM-partners blir du en del av en kultur som drivs av innovation, förtroende och en gemensam passion för att leverera världsledande produkter.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer att vara:** 




  




* Implementation av hårdvarunära C på egenutvecklade ARM-baserade fjädringsstyrenheter.
* Kravhantering med hjälp av Siemens Polarion.
* Utveckling av byggskript i Make, Python etc.
* Mjukvaruarkitektur och mjukvarudesign i UML med Sparx Enterprise Architect.
* Implementation av enhetstester med hjälp av CUnit-ramverk.
* Implementation av HIL-tester med Python.
* Regressionsbyggen och tester med Jenkins.
* Release hantering.



  





**För att lyckas i denna roll ser vi gärna följande kvalifikationer** 




  




* Högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av liknande arbete.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Goda kunskaper i hårdvarunära C-programmering.
* Strukturerat arbete med versionshanteringssystem.
* Trivs med nära samarbete i en agil scrum-miljö.



  





**Meriterande erfarenhet är:** 




  




* Fordonsdiagnostik med UDS/KWP.
* Kravhantering.
* CM-hantering.
* Versionshantering i SVN/Subversion.
* A och/eller B körkort.



  





**Personliga egenskaper:** 




  




* Du behöver inte kunna allt, men det är viktigt att du vågar fråga och ifrågasätta.
* Du har ordningssinne och är strukturerad.
* Du är driven, självgående och nyfiken.
* Du är en teamplayer som bidrar till hela gruppens leverans, kompetensutveckling och kundens nöjdhet.



  





**Varför Öhlins?** 




  





 Öhlins är ett svenskt teknikföretag med global närvaro och ett starkt renommé inom avancerade fjädringssystem. I nästan 50 år har man varit en viktig aktör inom motorsport och bilindustrin och bidragit till över 450 världsmästerskapstitlar.
 



  





 Sedan januari 2025 är Öhlins en del av italienska Brembo Group – världsledande inom bromslösningar – och stärkt företagets innovationsförmåga och öppnat nya dörrar för banbrytande utveckling.
 



  





 Öhlins sätter man kunderna i första rummet och levererar lösningar som överträffar förväntningarna. Kultur bygger på passion, samarbete och en drivkraft att tänja på gränserna. Man värdesätter förtroende, hållbarhet och långsiktiga partnerskap – både inom interna team och med partners över hela världen.
 



  





 Öhlins erbjuder en dynamisk, inkluderande miljö där människor från olika bakgrunder möts för att forma framtidens mobilitet.
 



  





 Exempel på förmåner som anställd på Öhlins:
 


* Subventionerad lunch i egen personalrestaurang.
* Fri tillgång till gym på arbetsplatsen.
* Friskvårdsbidrag.
* Work-life balance med flexibla arbetstider samt möjlighet till distansarbete där arbetet så tillåter.
* Gemensamma aktiviteter (såsom innebandy, ishockey, golf, skidresa, ban-dagar för auto och MC).
* Företagsrabatter på egna produkter.
* Subventionerade priser på naprapati/massage.
* Rabatterade priser på produkter och tjänster genom Benify förmånsportal.



  





**Ansökan** 




  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Öhlins med Quadruped Rekrytering. Hör av dig med frågor eller skicka din ansökan till carina.ronnby@quadruped.se alt 076-1017770. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
 



  





 Vill du veta mer är du välkommen att kontakta Quadruped Rekrytering enligt ovan.
 



  





**Sammanfattning:** 




  




* Roll: Embedded Software Application Engineer.
* Form: Fast anställning hos Öhlins.
* Placering: On-site, Stockholm (Upplands Väsby).
* Omfattning: 100%.

title: Scrum Master & Cloud Developer (C# & AWS)
description:
**Job Description:** 




 We are looking for a dynamic and technically skilled Scrum Master & Cloud Developer (C# & AWS) to join a high-performing team within the automotive industry. This role is a hybrid of agile leadership and hands-on development, ideal for someone who thrives in both collaborative and technical environments.
 



 You will work closely with two other developers to design, develop, and maintain backend features, while also facilitating Agile practices and driving continuous improvement within the team.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




 ·       Act as Scrum Master: facilitate daily stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, and support team delivery using Agile methodologies.
 



 ·       Develop and maintain backend solutions using C# and AWS serverless technologies.
 



 ·       Lead or contribute to architecture decisions and infrastructure automation using AWS CloudFormation/CDK.
 



 ·       Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines using GitLab CI/CD.
 



 ·       Work independently and proactively suggest improvements for code, process, and infrastructure.
 



 ·       Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure high software quality and system reliability.
 



 ·       Monitor application performance and operational health using tools like Grafana and JFrog.
 



  





**Required Skills & Experience:** 




 ·       3+ years of experience in software development with C#
 



 ·       Strong knowledge of AWS services such as Lambda, API Gateway, S3, DynamoDB, IAM, CloudFront, SQS, SNS, Route 53, WAF, CloudFormation, CDK, etc.
 



 ·       Hands-on experience in CI/CD pipelines, preferably with GitLab.
 



 ·       Familiar with Agile tools like Jira and best practices in Scrum.
 



 ·       Excellent communication skills in English.
 



 ·       Strong problem-solving skills, a quality-first mindset, and interest in operational excellence.
 



 ·       Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
 



 ·       Experience in the automotive industry

title: Embedded C/C++ Developers
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Are you a talented
 **C/C++ developer** 
 seeking your next opportunity? Join the Embedded Systems department in Stockholm, where exciting challenges await!
 



  





 The ALTEN Stockholm office is home to a dynamic, highly skilled team of engineers and developers from all over the world who specialize in delivering tailored solutions across sectors like automotive, telecommunications, life sciences, and IT. Known for their collaborative spirit, the team combines deep technical expertise with a proactive, problem-solving approach, fostering an environment where creativity and efficiency meet to drive impactful results for clients. With a strong focus on professional development and a supportive culture, the Stockholm team is dedicated to both individual growth and collective success, making it an exciting and empowering place to be a part of.
 



  





**WHAT WE OFFER YOU** 




 Every employee is equally valuable in the success of ALTEN! We believe in growing together by offering opportunities, development and togetherness.
 



 ALTEN operates in several different industries, having a wide variety of assignments, coaching managers and training through ALTEN Academy, which means that it will always be possible to develop at ALTEN. Your wishes will guide your way forward.
 



 As a consultant, you will get the genuine team feeling at your assignment but also a wonderful togetherness at ALTEN. Through our different internal networks, such as Women@ALTEN and ALTEN Sports you will get the opportunity to drive topics and activities that are close to your heart. At ALTEN, we think it's important to have a balance between work and spare time, which is why we offer three extra days off a year. We have a collective agreement and offer benefits like pension, insurances and wellness grants.
 



  





**WHAT WILL YOU DO** 




**Design and Develop** 
 : Create high-quality, real-time embedded software solutions in C++ for various industries.
 



**Innovate** 
 : Work on the latest technologies such as IoT, AI, and autonomous systems, contributing to exciting projects that shape the future.
 



**Collaborate** 
 : Join forces with talented engineers across multiple disciplines to deliver state-of-the-art products and systems.
 



**Problem Solve** 
 : Tackle technical challenges with creativity and out-of-the-box thinking, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.
 



**Grow** 
 : Expand your knowledge through ongoing training, support, and career development within a dynamic, international environment.
 



  





**WHO ARE YOU** 



* Degree in computer science, electrical engineering, or related field.
* 3+ years in Embedded C/C++ software development within the automotive industry.
* Strong proficiency in real-time systems, and embedded platforms (ARM, FPGA, etc.).
* Python
* Bash
* Jenkins
* Classic or Adaptive AUTOSAR.
* Meritorius: experience of Yocto and Buildroot as well as with microcontrollers.



  





**ABOUT ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors, such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9 offices in 9 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.

title: Senior Mobile Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU WILL DO:**
 As a Senior Software Engineer - Mobile in the organization you will be in the center of the action where both design and product meet business. You will be working closely with Product Managers, Engineering Managers, all product teams, iOS and Android community. You should have a strong technical background, a passion for developing SDKs, mobile application development, and a drive to deliver bug-free developer and user experiences as per the business requirement without compromising on the industry best coding practices. We are looking for highly skilled and experienced for the role of Senior Software Engineer - Mobile to lead the development team of our internal tools. As an Mobile Developer, you will be responsible for designing and delivering robust and scalable solutions. You will also provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior members in the iOS and Android community.
   

  

**Team Description**
 The Experimentation and Visual Analytics team is dedicated to the creation of advanced internal tools designed for analyzing various test variations and interpreting data effectively. This team plays a pivotal role in collaborating with all product teams across H&M, ensuring that they develop and implement the most optimized solutions for launching new features. By leveraging data-driven insights, they aim to enhance the overall efficiency and effectiveness of feature releases, ultimately contributing to H&M’s commitment to innovation and excellence in customer experience.
   

  

**You will:**
* Lead the end-to-end development of complex native and multiplatform solutions, from concept to development including testing, distribution and writing documentation.
* Drive technical decision-making, provide architectural guidance, and ensure the implementation of best practices.
* Collaborate closely with iOS and Android community, cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and backend developers, to define requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
* Develop scalable and maintainable libraries, ensuring adherence to coding best practices, design patterns, and architectural guidelines.
* Provide technical guidance and mentor junior iOS and Android developers, reviewing their PRs and providing constructive feedback.
* Perform thorough code reviews to ensure code quality, performance, and adherence to established coding standards.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of UI components and iOS/Android applications through thorough testing, debugging, and optimization. Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues and performance bottlenecks.
* Collaborate with other teams to understand and guide developers.
* Define test plans and ensure comprehensive test coverage.
* Drive innovation by researching and implementing cutting-edge technologies.
* Stay up to date with the latest trends and advancements in mobile development, evaluate new tools and frameworks, and promote their adoption when appropriate. Also, share knowledge and best practices with the iOS and Android community.
* Participate in architectural discussions, providing insights and proposing solutions to enhance system architecture and overall product quality.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of development processes and workflows.
* Participate in Agile/Scrum development processes, contribute to sprint planning, and provide accurate estimations for project timelines.
* Collaborate with Security and Compliance teams to ensure that mobile solutions adhere to internal policies and industry regulations.
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines and automation strategies to improve development workflows and reduce manual efforts.


**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with..*
* 6+ years of experience in mobile development (Android and/or iOS).
* Hands-on experience with Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) for shared codebases
* Strong proficiency in Kotlin for Android and Multiplatform module development.
* Proficiency in Swift, Objective-C and Kotlin for iOS and Android application and SDK integration.
* Familiarity with Jetpack Compose and SwiftUI.
* Experience in building and publishing mobile SDKs/libraries for internal or external use.
* Deep understanding of platform-specific architecture and constraints (Android/iOS).
* Experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing in both platforms.
* Familiarity with KMP testing strategies including using expect/actual declarations.
* Comfortable with debugging native iOS and Android issues within shared and platform-specific code.
* Experience with modular architecture, clean code principles, and design patterns like MVVM.
* Strong understanding of dependency injection, coroutines/flows, and asynchronous programming.
* Ability to collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (iOS, Android, backend, product).
* Comfortable contributing to API design, versioning, and developer experience for SDKs.
* Familiarity with tools such as GitHub Actions for CI/CD in mobile projects.
* Experience working in Agile/Scrum team, actively participating in ceremonies and contributing to continuous delivery
* Proven experience in leading cross-platform mobile teams or initiatives, especially in contexts involving KMP or shared codebases. Experience with mobile analytics tools (e.g., Firebase or similar) and feature flagging/experimentation frameworks.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Integration Developer
description:
At
 **Schibsted Media** 
 , our mission is to empower people in the Nordics to make informed decisions through high-quality journalism and innovative digital solutions. Behind the scenes, our Integration Solutions team ensures that systems and services are seamlessly connected, enabling efficient workflows and operations across the organization.
   

  

 We’re now looking for an
 **Integration Developer** 
 with expertise in
 **platform and infrastructure management** 
 to join our
 **Integration Solutions** 
 team. If you're passionate about building scalable integration systems, automating infrastructure, and working in a collaborative, open-minded team—this could be your next exciting challenge.
   

  

 In this role, you will have two main responsibilities - development and infrastructure management. You will be a key member of the development team, as well as collaborate closely with the infrastructure team to manage the platform infrastructure, ensuring seamless system integration and robust infrastructure management. You will ensure that the different components of the integration platform (logging, monitoring, deployment etc) work seamlessly together in a unified manner.
   

  

 🌍 Why this role matters
   

  

 With Schibsted transitioning into two distinct companies—
 **Schibsted Media** 
 and
 **Schibsted Marketplaces** 
 —our Integration Solutions team is playing a key role in building a future-ready integration landscape. We’re establishing a new
 **Integration Competency Center (ICC)** 
 to support this transformation, and you’ll be part of shaping the tools, processes, and infrastructure that support essential business operations across HR, Finance, Payroll, and more.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

 As an Integration Developer focused on platform and infrastructure, you will:
   

  

* ✅ Design, develop, test, and deploy scalable and secure integration solutions.
* ✅ Manage infrastructure components using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform.
* ✅ Drive CI/CD adoption by building tools and automating workflows with GitHub Actions.
* ✅ Monitor and maintain platform performance with proactive incident and environment management.
* ✅ Implement DevOps best practices across multiple environments to ensure efficiency and resilience.
* ✅ Collaborate with both IT and business stakeholders to translate needs into practical, scalable solutions.
* ✅ Work closely with Solution Architects and Integration Architects to continuously evolve our integration platform.
* ✅ Actively contribute to a transparent, agile team environment—sharing responsibilities like the Scrum Master role.


 Who you are
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment and values honest collaboration. You might be a great match if you:
   

  

* ✅ Are passionate about technology and creating well-functioning, scalable integration solutions.
* ✅ Have a DevOps mindset and enjoy combining development with infrastructure work.
* ✅ A strong communicator who can explain complex technical concepts in simple terms.
* ✅ Are pragmatic, proactive, and always looking for opportunities to improve tools and processes.
* ✅ Enjoy working closely with others and helping build a collaborative team culture.
* ✅ Embrace feedback and continuous learning as part of your daily work.


 What you bring
   

  

 We're looking for a strong mix of technical skills and collaborative mindset. Ideally, you have:
   

  

* 🔧 Hands-on experience designing and implementing integration solutions using tools like MuleSoft, Azure Integration Services, APIs, and event-driven messaging.
* 🔄 Solid understanding of CI/CD principles and the ability to automate deployments with GitHub Actions.
* 🧱 Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools, especially Terraform.
* 🧠 Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for creating maintainable, high-quality solutions.
* 🤝 The ability to work independently while contributing actively to an agile, team-driven environment.


 Why join Schibsted?
   

  

 At Schibsted, we’re more than a media company—we’re a community of bold thinkers, problem solvers, and truth-seekers. We believe that innovation, transparency, and inclusivity are key to supporting independent journalism and trustworthy media.
   

  

 By joining us, you’ll play a key part in transforming the way our teams collaborate and operate. You’ll also have the chance to help shape a brand-new Integration Competency Center that supports our mission and empowers people across our organisation to work smarter and more connected.
   

  

**📩 Ready to make an impact? Apply now and help us build the infrastructure behind Schibsted Media’s future.**

title: Senior Developer till Kleer
description:
**💛 It all comes Kleer – PE Accounting byter namn**
 Kleer (tidigare PE Accounting) grundades för att revolutionera ekonomi- och lönebranschen genom ledande teknik och ekonomiexpertis. Idag erbjuder vi marknadens mest automatiserade system med över 80% automationsgrad, men vi stannar inte där – vi vill mer. Vi blir Kleer!
   

  

**Vill du vara med på resan? Blir en del av vårt team som senior utvecklare!**
 👉🏼 Hos oss blir du en del av ett starkt team av engagerade utvecklare vars dagliga arbete & åsikter är avgörande för bolagets fortsatta tillväxt. Som utvecklare på Kleer arbetar du i en helt egenutvecklad produkt, som vi utvecklar och produktionssätter och du får stor kreativ frihet och möjligheter att ständigt växa i rollen som utvecklare på Kleer! Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida
   

  

**Vår Utvecklingsmiljö**
 Vi är ett produktbolag med en modern, agil utvecklingsprocess där teamen själva sätter sina milstolpar och sköter prioriteringen utifrån uppsatta affärsmål. Vi tror starkt på att det är roligare att arbeta om man förstår användarnas behov och ser utmaningar och möjligheter. Därför arbetar varje squad med en del av applikationen, men i hela teknikstacken. Vårt inhouse-utvecklingsteam består idag av utvecklare fördelat på 5 team, där teamen samarbetar nära en dedikerad produktägare.
   

  

 Kodbasen, som till största del är skriven i Java, är välskriven och vi kvalitetssäkrar vår kod genom automatiserade tester. Vi uppgraderar löpande till senaste versionen av våra verktyg och tredjepartskomponenter. Hela miljön är containerbaserad och releaser görs veckovis.
   

  

 Vi har ett helt nytt, fräscht och påkostat kontor i centrala Stockholm (Fleminggatan 14) där vi möts, tar en pingismatch, utbyter idéer och samlas runt en whiteboard eller för ett retrospective. Vi vet att även flexibilitet i vardagen är viktigt, därför finns det även möjligheten att arbeta remote!
   

  

**Rollen Som Senior Developer På Kleer**
 Som Senior Developer hos oss kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att utveckla och förbättra vår produkt samt bidra till företagets tekniska resa framåt. Vi tror att du trivs i ett modernt produktbolag och i en roll där du får chans att verkligen vara med och påverka produkten och utvecklingen av den.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden i rollen 👇🏼
   

  

* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från kravspecifikation till implementering
* Samarbeta nära Product Owner, Engineering Manager och teammedlemmar för att säkerställa att produktens vision och tekniska mål uppnås
* Ett tekniskt ansvar för en del av applikationen när det kommer till datamodell, arkitektur, prestanda, säkerhet m.m.
* Bidra med din tekniska expertis och erfarenhet för att kontinuerligt förbättra våra utvecklingsprocesser


**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du har flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av Java samt SQL och du är inte rädd för att komma med egna tankar och idéer som vi tillsammans förverkligar! Du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat. Som person är du nyfiken och motiveras av att testa och lära dig nya saker inom ditt område.
   

  

**Mer Om Kleer Som Bolag**
 Vi grundades 2011 och är ett modernt & värderingsstyrt produktbolag. I över 12 år har vi skapat innovation och hjälpt små & medelstora bolag att automatisera sin ekonomi. Vi har en väldigt stabil affärsmodell som bolag och växer organiskt, med sunda finanser - vilket bland annat har gjort oss till sexfaldiga DI Gaseller. I skrivande stund närmar vi oss 200 kollegor och finns med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg & Malmö.
   

  

*Vi ser verkligen fram emot att höra ifrån dig!*
 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

*Sökord: Java 19, Spring, Docker, REST, Linux, MySQL, Microservices, IntelliJ, Jenkins, Git, Remix. Fullstack, Backend, Produktbolag.*
 Vi på Kleer ändrar sättet världen ser på ekonomi- och lönehantering!
   

  

 Vårt automatiserade system, i kombination med vår tjänsteleverans bildar tillsammans en helhetslösning som ger våra kunder möjligheten att outsourca sin ekonomifunktion, och samtidigt behålla 100% kontroll - i realtid.
   

  

 Vi har en stabil affärsmodell, där över 90% av intäkterna är prenumerationsbaserade. Tillväxten har skett organiskt och med sunda finanser. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på glädje, ansvar, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet!

title: ServiceNow Developers - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
*Are you a swedish speaking pro in ServiceNow and passionate about outstanding customer experience?*
 At Tietoevry Tech Services Sweden, we modernize our customers IT landscape to drive efficiency, agility, innovation and to realize their digital ambitions. Our customers are large Nordic organizations operating in various industries as well as in the public sector. Our aim is to become the market leader in the Nordics and the first choice for our customers’ business renewal. ServiceNow is one of the leading Enterprise Service Management platforms and a focus area for Tietoevry in the Nordic market. We are therefore now looking for
 **ServiceNow Developers** 
 to perform creative work with our customers.
   

  

**When Joining Tietoevry Tech Services As a Servicenow Developer**
* You will work in DevOps model to implement/expand ServiceNow modules ITSM, HR, IRM for our customers
* Implement/modify integrations using REST API or Integration Hub
* Explain and present new ideas and solutions to our customers
* Analyze and resolve production issues around implemented solution based on ServiceNow
* Handle code migration from development to test to production instances of ServiceNow
* Support end users with queries around ServiceNow based implemented solution
* Be a part o a global team


**We Offer You**
 You will make your mark in meaningful projects (for example, developing solutions including ITSM and HR modules of ServiceNow integrating with 3rd party tools). We are a global team with Nordic heritage. With us, you will work with diverse team of experts in an inclusive environment. We also offer you flexibility and a good work-life balance. We will also offer ServiceNow trainings and conferences for you to get relevant certifications.
   

  

**We Believe You To Have**
* Certification as a ServiceNow Administrator
* A few years of experience in ServiceNow developer/ support role
* Strong technical knowledge about ServiceNow ITSM, HR and/or IRM module
* Good Knowledge about ServiceNow On-Premise implementation
* Fluent in swedish and english


**It is meritarious if you also:**
* Are a Certified Implementation Specialist
* Prior exposure working with international teams located across Europe.


 As a person, we believe you to be communicative, keen to work in a global environment, collaborative and a problem solver.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?** 
  

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Amit Ambre, amit.ambre@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
   

  

 Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Platform Engineer
description:
Stories have the power to make the ordinary extraordinary. They help us think bigger, see beyond ourselves, and deepen our connection with others.
 



  





 As one of the world’s leading audiobook and e-book streaming platforms, Storytel brings unlimited listening to millions of users across 25 markets. We bring stories to life across various formats for everyone to discover. Anytime. Anywhere.
 



  





 Ready for your next chapter? Our Platform Engineering team is on the lookout for another colleague in Stockholm! Due to ongoing summer vacations, the response time is longer than usual.
 



  





**About the Team** 




 The Platform Engineering team focuses on setting up, operating and redefining observability, infrastructure, CI/CD, runtime tooling and common shared services at Storytel. We apply software engineering principles to accelerate software delivery and ensure that application development teams are productive in all aspects of the software delivery lifecycle.
 



  





 Our team’s expertise is very diverse, ranging from cloud infrastructure to security to development and machine learning tools and services.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 At Storytel, Engineers are viewed as leaders within the individual contributor roles, aiming to create impact and drive initiatives to bring our audio entertainment service to millions of users.
 



  





 You’ll be part of an engineering team that works with cutting-edge technologies alongside experienced colleagues. Your main tasks will be designing, building and maintaining toolchains and workflows that help our teams manage the full life-cycle of their systems. This includes:
 


* Building tools, libraries for our common languages, templates, automation, and configurations.
* Working with observability, deployment pipelines, quality assurance, availability, machine learning and more.
* Guiding developers in their daily work on how they best utilize the tools provided by the team.
* Working with different technologies, including ArgoCD, GitHub, GitHub Actions, Grafana, Prometheus, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Atlantis), Fastly, Airflow and more.



  





**About You** 




***To be successful in this role, we believe that you have:***



* At least 3 years of experience as a software engineer, platform engineer, or equivalent. You’re experienced in developing in Java or Go.
* Experience and a keen interest in working in the Developer Experience (DevEx) area. For example, deployment pipelines, observability & monitoring, quality assurance, automation, self-service, and runtime platforms.
* Experience working with container technologies, Kubernetes, and distributed systems.
* Experience working with Cloud Service Providers - Google Cloud Platform, Azure or AWS.
* Ability to communicate professionally in English (written and spoken).



  





***And for some bonus points, you have experience or a keen interest in:***



* Working with Databases - MySQL, Postgres, etc.
* Infrastructure-as-code and configuration management.
* Basic knowledge of Linux/Unix operating systems.
* Machine learning tools and services.



  





**Join a world of stories** 




 At Storytel, we’re a team of creative story lovers who thrive on collaboration and new ideas. Our workplace is friendly, dynamic, and full of opportunities to experiment and make an impact. We believe in trust, flat hierarchies, and empowering you to grow with us.
 



  





 Does this sound like your next story? Simply fill out the application form and share your CV or LinkedIn profile – no cover letter needed. Answer a few questions, and you’re all set.

title: System Architect
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, Spectator Sports, and Entertainment Providers
description:
**Own the architecture and technical strategy of the infrastructure platform that enables our global sports-tech system, deployed in thousands of locations worldwide** 




  





**WANT TO REVOLUTIONIZE GOLF?** 




  





**Our mission** 
 is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by developing tracing technology for TV and gamification to ranges. Our product brings people together and encourages them to get active which enables a healthier lifestyle. Our range technology is used globally and millions of people spend their quality time bonding and playing with their family and friends. Our broadcast technology is aired worldwide and makes the tournaments really enjoyable for the TV viewers. ⛳️ 📺 🎥
 



  





**At our new office** 
 , you can expect to meet humble, helpful and driven colleagues. You will join an organization where everyone has a voice and can make an impact. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to something meaningful as we undergo exciting changes and growth. We are committed to creating an environment where you can grow professionally and individually. As well as creating a social work environment by creating fun activities like morning fika, gym sessions, mob programming, after-work, table tennis, and golf simulator sessions to name a few! 🥳 🏓 ☕️
 



  





**We are proud** 
 to be on a journey where we're focused on helping people worldwide improve their golf game which leads to healthy, active and social lifestyles. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our newly renovated R&D office in Stockholm, Sweden. Join us at Toptracer Technologies and be part of a team dedicated to creating positive change through technology and innovation! 🚀 💻 💙
 



  





 At our R&D office we have 150+ people building everything from circuit boards, metal frames and mechanics to algorithms, image processing, apps, and games. Our development spans from nuts and bolts to the cloud and 3D games. We develop our own cameras, design electronics, and create experiences that blend physical interaction with digital interfaces.
 



 In this role, you’ll have the chance to work across that full spectrum. This gives you the chance to influence the whole product development process - from idea to execution - and not just the implementation. Join an experienced team that influences infrastructure, hardware, software, and system design—without owning production code.
 



 We’re looking for a Technical Leader to own the architecture and technical strategy of the infrastructure platform that enables our global sports-tech system, deployed in thousands of locations worldwide. Our system powers high-performance golf ball tracking using custom cameras, embedded compute, edge servers, and cloud-connected infrastructure.
 



 You will lead the architecture and integration of hardware components from external vendors with our in-house developed software and hardware systems. These systems must perform consistently in real-world environments that are often unpredictable and beyond our control
 



  





**POSSIBILITIES** 



* Define and maintain technical architecture and integration strategy for third-party hardware.
* Ensure vendor systems meet requirements for environmental robustness and software compatibility.
* Align configuration, monitoring, and deployment models across edge components.
* Shape how we build and scale installations (“sites”) as reliable, networked systems in the field.
* Influence infrastructure, software configuration, and system design—without writing production code.



  





  





**WE BELIEVE YOU HAVE** 



* Background in embedded or hardware-near system design and architecture.
* Experience working with Linux environments.
* Past experience as a developer working in an agile environment using iterative approaches.
* Hands-on experience with field-deployed systems involving complex interactions between networking, computing, and interface components.
* Proven ability to collaborate across engineering disciplines and vendors.
* Skilled in balancing cost, durability, and complexity in system integration.
* Strong communication skills and a structured, clarity-driven approach.
* Experience working with hardware vendors and manufacturers, from specification to validation.



  





**Bonus competencies** 




 Experience evaluating trade-offs between embedded, FPGA-based, and general-purpose computing with cost-efficiency and reliability in mind.
 



  





**MORE ABOUT TOPTRACER** 




  





**Workplace** 




 We value fully engaged associates who come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from the activities and moments we share together and the product we are developing.
 



  





 In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range near your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.
 



  





**Culture** 




 Our culture is driven by our mission to create moments that matter for everyone and our values for Caring, Courage, One Team, Fun and Excellence.
 



  





**Activities** 



* After-work
* Pair/Mob programming
* Conference
* Dart
* Gym sessions
* Table-tennis
* Golf simulator
* Golf tournaments



  





**Benefits** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and projects.
* Collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.
* A hybrid work environment with the primary workplace at our cozy and welcoming office in Mörby Centrum, Danderyd.
* And of course, play golf!



  





 The position is permanent and full-time, located at our office in Stockholm. We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Senior Android developer with a Design-Driven Mindset
description:
Looking for a job where you can actually make a difference? Paf isn’t your typical gaming company. We were started by the Red Cross, Save the Children, Public Health on Åland, and the Dagens Barn foundation.
   

  

 We’re all about building something sustainable for the long run. All our profits go to charitable organizations that work to make society better.
   

  

****JOIN OUR APP TEAM!****
 We’re looking for a senior Android developer who’s got a good eye for design and a real curiosity and passion for modern Android development. In the App Team, you’ll be part of the journey to build apps for all 20 of our websites in 5 different countries. It’s a skilled and friendly team where everyone’s ideas count, and the mindset is open and collaborative.
   

  

****THE ROLE****
 In this role, we’re looking for someone who not only writes solid code, but also cares about how things look and feel. You’ll be involved in the whole development process, just like the rest of the team, but your main strength will be making sure the design is consistent and looks great all the way through. You’ll work closely with our UI and UX designers to create smooth, user-friendly experiences that look awesome.
   

  

**YOUR PROFILE**
 You have at least 5 years of Android development experience, and are as passionate about design as you are about code.
   

  

**You also:**
* Have professional experience working with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose.
* Are skilled in Figma and understand good design principles.
* Willing to take on additional responsibility for the design of our Android apps.


**Bonus points if you also have experience with:**
* iOS development
* TypeScript
* AWS or other cloud platforms


**We value practical experience over formal education. You’ll stand out if you demonstrate:**
* Strong communication skills.
* A team-oriented mindset.
* Independence and accountability.


**WE OFFER**
* A collaborative, flexible work culture prioritizing well-being.
* Occupational healthcare and insurance.
* A workplace that encourages individuality and personal growth.
* A strong focus on well-being and work-life balance - we avoid overtime unless absolutely necessary.
* Generous support for remote work setups and wellness, including coverage for your Wi-Fi and home office setup.
* Option to work abroad up to 3 months per year.


**PRACTICAL INFO**
* READ BEFORE APPLYING


 To be eligible for this role, you
 **must** 
 have:
   

  

* A valid work permit for working in Sweden.
* Minimum of three years of work experience in Sweden
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written.


**Start Date:** 
 As soon as possible, depending on notice period
   

  

**Type** 
 : Full-time, permanent with a 6-month probation
   

  

**Location:** 
 Flexible - 100% remote, hybrid, or based in our offices in Stockholm, Norrköping, or Mariehamn.
   

  

**Application:** 
 Only via our application form (GDPR compliance)
   

  

**Recruitment Process:** 
 Includes a programming test and technical interviews.
   

  

 We review applications continuously and close the process once we find the right person. Don’t wait to apply!

title: Fullstack/Webb-utvecklare
description:
**Om företaget** 




 Vi är Delorean, en prisbelönt digital byrå som hjälper företag och organisationer att utveckla innovativa strategier, digitala tjänster och kreativa kommunikationslösningar. Vi är stolt vinnare av Årets Digitala Byrå 2024 och har ett härligt gäng medarbetare som brinner för att skapa digital framgång. Vi har en stark teamkänsla där du får vara med och påverka både din egen arbetssituation och företaget. Vi tror på att lära oss tillsammans och utvecklas med nya tekniker som kommer. Vi jobbar bland annat med kunder som 7-Eleven, Pressbyrån, Vogue Scandinavia, Nationalmuseum och Statens Konstråd.
 



  




**Om tjänsten** 

 Vi söker nu efter fullstack-utvecklare.
 



  





 Arbetsuppgifterna varierar mycket. Vi jobbar med flera lite större utvecklingsprojekt som ofta har en digital affär. Men vi skapar även kundspecifika verktyg, andra CMS-baserade lösningar, datadrivna prestandaförbättringar med mer.
 



 Vi värdesätter en glad personlighet och ett stort intresse för webbutveckling. Ägnar du dessutom en del av din fritid till att förbättra din kompetens och undersöka nya ramverk och tekniker har vi mycket gemensamt.
 



 Vår teknikfilosofi är att använda rätt verktyg till det utmaningen kräver. Därför är vi inte rädda att både testa och utvärdera nya tekniker, samt att implementera dessa i skarpa projekt. Vi undviker att välja verktyg enbart på popularitet eller gammal vana.
 



 De flesta av våra projekt är headless i React där det finns en eller flera backends i Node, PHP eller .Net
 



 Det som är viktigt för oss är inte att du är fullärd, utan att du har en positiv attityd och ett intresse för att lära dig nya saker.
 



  




**Din roll i teamet** 
* Programmera front- och backend.
* Ansvara för och driva olika webbprojekt.
* Ta fram tekniska strategier och koncept med vårt team av utvecklare, UX:are och projektledare.
* Ha kundkontakt och svara på frågor relaterade till projekten.
* Ha code reviews med utvecklingsteamet.
* Pratar och skriver svenska flytande, då detta ett krav från våra kunder.



  




**Vi tror du har erfarenhet av** 
* Någon form av backend-programmering, exempelvis något av: .NET, Node.js, PHP, Python, Ruby, Go, C#.
* HTML, CSS och JavaScript.
* Versionshantering i GIT.
* JavaScript-frameworks så som React, Angular, Vue
* Att utveckla integrationer och kopplingar till andra system via API:er.



  




**Extra meriterande** 
* Umbraco, Episerver / Optimizely
* Bra koll på Devops-relaterade verktyg och processer, Nginx, Docker, CI-lösningar osv.
* Wordpress
* Craft CMS
* Erfarenhet av GraphQL
* SASS/LESS eller liknande-CSS preprocessors.
* Erfarenhet av funktionell programmering.
* Erfarenhet av Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, DataStudio, Optimize.



  




**Varför ska du jobba på Delorean?** 

 När du jobbar hos oss kan vi bland annat erbjuda följande:
 


* Vi är kollektivanslutna: För dig innebär det att du garanteras bra villkor och att saker som betald föräldraledighet, semester, tjänstepension, rätt till löneförhöjning och mycket mer är självklarheter.
* Du får tjänstepension: En vacker dag går du i pension. Som kollektivanslutet företag betalar vi in till din tjänstepension från att du fyllt 25 år.
* Du får friskvårdsbidrag: Alla som jobbar hos oss ska få de bästa förutsättningarna för att hålla sig friska och krya. Vi erbjuder bidrag på 5000 kr per år som du kan använda till din personliga träning.
* Kompetensutveckling och delaktighet: Vi har regelbundna medarbetarsamtal samt tar fram individuella utvecklingsplaner. Och vi vill att våra medarbetare är med och påverkar både arbetsplats och hur vi arbetar.



  





 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan!

title: Python-utvecklare - Castra
description:
*Vi utmanar de traditionella konsultbolagen och vi kan med stolthet säga att Castra är konsultbranschens mest utvecklande arbetsplats där allt är möjligt. Känns det här som företaget för dig så läs gärna vidare.*
**Rollen**
 I rollen som Senior Python-utvecklare kommer du att spela en central roll i utvecklingen av innovativa och högpresterande system ute hos våra kunder. Du arbetar nära både teknik och verksamhet för att skapa lösningar.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med uppdrag inom både privat och offentlig sektor. Hos oss har du full kontroll över din arbetstid, kompetensutveckling, ersättning, pension, semester och uppdrag!
   

  

**Erfarenhet**
* Minst 8 års erfarenhet av Python-utveckling samt arbetat med Django och / eller Flask
* Djup förståelse för backend-arkitektur, API:er och mikrotjänster.
* Van att arbeta med molntjänster som AWS, Azure eller GCP.
* Arbetat med containerteknologier som Docker eller Kubernetes.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-pipelines, testautomatisering och DevOps-processer.
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsaspekter och databas.


**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.
   

  

**Om Castra**
 Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.
   

  

 Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.
   

  

 Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Annelie.nilsson@castra.se Tel: +46 76- 531 45 81
