title: Product Designer H&M Womens – Regional Assortment
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 We are looking for an experienced Senior Designer to join our Regional Assortment department with a focus on our Indian region. This position will be based in our Head office in Stockholm but will require some travel to India.
   

  

 As a Designer for Regional Relevance, you will focus on creating collections for our different regions that require special attention to tailor our collections to suit the relevant target customer. As a Product Designer you will work closely with our teams in both Stockholm and India to achieve this. You will set extended visual goals based on our main collection and will plan the assortment on a concept level together with the Regional Relevance Manager and Design Lead. You will be working with a wide assortment along with key fashion drops and local campaigns.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 As a Senior Designer you will work alongside our Lead Designer and will be part of a wider team of Designers, Product Developers, Planners, Pattern Makers, and a Product Manager.
   

  

 We are looking for Designers who love to collaborate, work in a team, and provide our diverse markets with the best products sold worldwide. Your handwriting will demonstrate a strong fashion level with commercial awareness! It will be key also to keep a high fashion sense for style and trends for the target customer, while maintaining a cost-conscious awareness throughout the design process.
   

  

 This is an amazing opportunity to collaborate with our fashion conscious, forward thinking global team. There will also be opportunities to travel to South Asia along the way.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a Designer with....
   

  

* A minimum of a BA/MA or equivalent experience in Fashion/Textile Design.
* 3+ years’ work experience as a Designer.
* Background from an aspirational global brand or retailer.
* International experience would be advantageous.
* High attention to detail with strong knowledge on Womenswear products.
* A creative mindset with a sharp eye for both current and future trends.
* Strong customer focus and commercial mindset for H&M´s global womenswear customer.
* Experience working closely with suppliers/factories in Asia and Europe.
* Strong skills in and used to working in Adobe Creative Suite programs.
* 3D CLO is advantageous.
* Demonstrated communication skills and a true collaborative team player.
* Independent, driven & proactive with “one step ahead” mindset.
* Organized & structured, able to set priorities and follow timelines.
* Flexible mindset and adaptable to changes in a fast-moving & growing industry.
* Experience or a desire to coach Junior Designers would be beneficial.
* Fluent in English (Swedish not necessary).


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 This is a full-time position is based in Stockholm. You will report to the department Assortment Designer
   

  

 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including CV and relevant portfolio work (pdf max 10mb/uploading). All documents should be in English.
   

  

 For internal candidates: please remember to always speak with your current manager when applying for an internal role. Please know that if you are currently permanently employed, you will keep this base employment status while taking on a temporary role.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.


 The journey starts here

title: Senior Product Designer - Stockholm
description:
Come and build something monumental for Healthcare!
   

  

 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

***Please Note:** 
 Applications will close EOD July 11th so take your time to apply - you don't have to be first and all applications will be reviewed!*
***We will review applications after the summer break from August 1st and interviews will follow** 
 .*
**About The Role**
 As a Senior Product Designer at Tandem, you'll be instrumental in shaping our user experience. You’ll collaborate closely with our brilliant Engineering team, and company leadership to craft intuitive, elegant, and impactful experiences.
   

  

 We’re a fast-moving team, so this role is a great fit if you thrive in ambiguity, can make progress with imperfect information, and is energized by rapid iteration. We work in short cycles: ship, learn, improve. Perfection isn’t the goal - momentum and learning are.
   

  

 What You will Do
   

  

* Lead end-to-end design work - from research and ideation to execution
* Conduct user interviews and distill insights into actionable product decisions
* Partner with engineering to ensure design aligns with technical constraints
* Share early work regularly (from sketches to prototypes) to gather feedback
* Collaborate across teams to inform design and product direction
* Contribute to product strategy while delivering polished interaction and visual design


 What You Bring
   

  

* Proven experience designing digital products with a strong user-centered focus
* Strong visual design skills and a compelling UX/UI portfolio
* Proficiency in Figma and design systems
* Experience leading user research and usability testing
* Comfort working cross-functionally and managing diverse feedback
* Ability to think strategically while sweating the design details
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity and evolving problem spaces


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Experience in early-stage startups


 Location
   

  

 We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.
   

  

 How to Apply
   

  

 We will consider applications until
 **EOD on July 11th 2025** 
 , so please make sure to apply with your CV in English before then.
 ***Applications will be reviewed from August 1st 2025***
 .
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with Talent Acquisition
* First interview & Portfolio review with our Product Design Lead
* Follow up interview with our CTO and Co-Founder
* Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary & company stock options
* 25 days/year of paid vacation
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare
* Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
 Culture at Tandem
   

  

 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

title: Data Analytics Consultant
description:
**About Making Science** 




  





 Making Science is an international digital acceleration company with over 1,200 experts across 15 markets, including Spain, Portugal, Mexico, Colombia, France, Italy, the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, Germany, Georgia, and the USA. As a proud consulting partner of Local Planet — the world’s premier network of independent media agencies — we deliver a suite of digital, technology, and performance marketing services to a global clientele. Our expertise spans digital marketing and MarTech, software and cloud solutions, artificial intelligence, and SaaS, all underscored by a relentless pursuit of innovation.
 



  





 Making Science was ranked 15th in the FT1000: Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies 2023. Committed to making a positive impact, Making Science actively engages in various ESG initiatives. We’ve joined forces with the Climate Pledge, the United Nations Global Compact, and Pledge1%, dedicating resources and efforts to support non-profit organizations. Through these endeavors, we are committed to driving meaningful change for a brighter, more sustainable future.
 



  





 As part of its commitment to innovation, Making Science offers its clients end-to-end capabilities required for consulting, development, integration, and maintenance of advanced IT solutions. Our global network of delivery hubs not only fosters job growth but also serves as an incubator for cultivating top-tier tech talent, fueling projects that accelerate transformation and modernisation.
 



  





 Our team is composed of digital native professionals, who have a wide knowledge in the different stages and disciplines of the digital transformation: Digital Strategy, Infrastructures, Software Development, Creativity and UX/UI Design, Digital Marketing, and Big Data.
 



  





 Making Science is People Centric, and we actively bet on our employees! We believe that they are the key to any successful business, and therefore, our greatest asset. We strive to provide daily learning opportunities for those who work with us and their colleagues. It is also really important that they enjoy what they do, and have positive experiences. We want our employees to feel proud of their accomplishments, and that they belong to a company that is in constant growth, because each person’s contribution is essential to achieve our success. Do you want to be part of this great family?
 



  





**📝Some details about your department** 




  





 At Data we are a young, energetic, and fun team! We believe that shared knowledge, teamwork, and internal training are the basis of a versatile, integrated, and powerful team. We value a thirst for knowledge, curiosity, and self-learning capabilities, because they help us stay up to date in an industry as dynamic as digital marketing. We are committed to the promotion of team building events, both inside and outside of the company, that will help us get to know each other better. So, if you think you fit in, don't hesitate and apply to our offer!
 







**🎯 What we’d like you to do** 




  





 Advance knowledge of Google suite (Including Google Analytics, GA4, GTM and DataStudio)
 



 Follow-up on clients
 



 Analyze and optimize web pages and apps in order to achieve set goals.
 



 Identify digital assets and web page structures that guarantee the best measurements.
 



 Create personalized dashboards and reports based on the client’s objectives (Using Power BI, DataStudio, Qlikview or Tableau)
 



 Develop measurement strategies that tie business objectives to digital measurement solutions and optimize the conversion funnel.
 



 Implementation of the measurement strategies for web and app.
 



 Configuration of campaign pixels and web measurement in GTM
 



 Configuration of measurement strategies in App applications. And configuration of campaign tracking for App (deep linking)
 



 Create A/B and multivariate tests to improve a web’s conversion rate on different devices.
 



 Configuration of measurement strategies in App applications. And configuration of campaign tracking for App (deep linking)
 



  





**🔊 What we’d like you to bring** 




  





 We are looking for someone who’s proactive and eager to learn, and has the capacity to adapt to new challenges with a positive attitude.
 



 You have preavious experience in Data & CRO experience.
 



 Advance knowledge of Google suite (Including Google Analytics, GA4, GTM and DataStudio)
 



 You have an advanced level of English, both spoken and written.
 



 You have knowledge of JavaScript and/or web layouts.
 



 You have knowledge of SQL and BigQuery.
 



 English C1 / C2
 



 Minimum of 4 years of experience
 



  





 ✔️
 **Perks of joining us** 




  





 We give you complete stability with an indefinite job contract.
 



 We offer a fixed salary according to your worth and experience, plus a performance based bonus.
 



 Get the most out of your salary with our Flexible Payment Plan (Restaurant Ticket, Transportation Ticket, Day Care Ticket, and Medical Insurance).
 



 Do you know someone that fits in Making Science? Refer him or her, and you can get a bonus if they’re hired!
 



 Feedback is part of our day to day lives. We recognize a job well done through a continuous feedback model.
 



 The opportunity to meet our international team with our Ambassadors Program.
 



 We care about a healthy work-life balance. You can count on having flexible working hours and one day a week where you can work from home.
 



 You will never stop learning with us: subsidized training, free language classes, learning capsules, an e-learning platform, and many more.
 



 Pack your bags! You’ll have 23 vacation days, plus 24th, 31st of December and San Publicito are off, and we have afternoons off on the eve of national holidays.
 



 Work comfortably and follow your own style, because we don’t have a dress code.
 



 We know how to have a good time!
 



 Never go hungry with our free daily fruit and our vending machine card!
 



 Take a break on our terrace, play foosball, darts, or PlayStation
 



 Be a part of a young, adventurous, and professional team, with people you’ll grow fond of!

title: SEO Specialist
description:
📍Stockholm
   

  

 📆 As soon as possible
   

  

 👩🏽‍💻 Office: 3 Days a Week
   

  

 📚 Our Recruitment Process
   

  

 At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.
   

  

 Are you curious to learn more about us? Read more about us here. For insights into what life is like at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.
   

  

*We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.*
**What You Will Be Doing**
* Independently execute and optimise SEO tactics, ensuring they are aligned with the set strategic direction.
* Handle day-to-day operational tasks, including analysis, optimisation, and reporting, to ensure high-quality execution and optimal organic performance in standard search and search generative experiences.
* Extract and analyse data to uncover trends and insights that can guide tactical decisions and continuous improvement efforts.
* Conduct in-depth SEO analysis and audits to identify opportunities for improving brand strength and performance metrics.
* Implement testing initiatives, analyse results, and make optimisation recommendations to improve organic performance.
* Provide clients with concise, actionable recommendations based on data-driven insights, guiding strategic decisions.
* Collaborate closely with other Solution Groups to action learnings into the overall success of client experience and delivery.
* Proactively contribute to the overall growth of the SEO business.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Solid understanding of the digital marketing ecosystem, with the ability to operationally navigate all three pillars of SEO (Technical, Content & Authority) as well as AI generated search.
* Comprehensive hands-on experience and knowledge in using SEO tools & platforms (e.g. Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, or similar) to tailor SEO strategies for brand and performance objectives.
* Technical acumen to identify, mitigate and resolve SEO-related issues, ensuring smooth execution of SEO activities.
* Strong capability to analyse performance data, identify trends, and derive actionable insights to enhance SEO efforts.
* Capability to design and implement roadmaps to achieve client goals and correlated targets, as well as showcase untapped opportunities within SEO and CRO.
* Ability to develop hypotheses and conduct tests to inform continuous improvement practices.
* Effective communication skills for engaging with clients on operational aspects and contributing to strategic conversations.
* Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g. LookerStudio) and ability to present insights in an engaging and understandable manner.
* In addition to specialisation in SEO, be comfortable with CRO & UX fundamentals and how these work together to impact total website performance.


**What We Offer**
*You can read our full offering in our* 
*handbook.*
* An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
* A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
* Transparent salary setting, you can find all our salary bands in our handbook. This role is an L2 role within the Media, Client & SEO/CRO column. Check it out!
* 30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
* A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.


**We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.**

title: Senior Visual Designer
description:
Are you ready to impact the future of gaming through design? North Kingdom is looking for an experienced visual designer to join our team in Stockholm.
 



 You will be a key-part of our team in shaping, defining and crafting the visual vision of our projects. As a Designer you are passionate about the craft, always curious, and leave no details behind. At North Kingdom, we take pride in always striving to deliver world-class experiences and services for clients such as Google, Supercell, EA, Riot and 10 Chambers.
 



 You have a solid understanding of UX, and are able to execute design solutions that not only look good, but also feel alive and great to use.
 



 This position is full time and based in Stockholm with a hybrid working model. Make sure to attach a link to your portfolio (Applicants with no portfolio won't be reviewed).
 



  






 Responsibilities
 




 In your role you will have a wide range of tasks that will include:
 


* Make sure the entire team understands the visual vision and feels motivated to strive toward the same goal
* Present and pitch to clients
* Take design briefs and create design systems/solutions, protecting the quality and craft of the ideas when they move through to production



  






 Requirements & Skills
 



* Several years of experience within digital design, preferably at a digital production company or agency
* Deep knowledge of applications like Figma, Photoshop, and Illustrator
* Great understanding of the opportunities and limitations of the modern web
* Great aesthetic sensibilities, experience in motion a plus
* Comfortable with and used to speaking and presenting in English
* Exceptional communication skills both in writing and speech
* A relevant degree or education in design (a plus, not a requirement)
* A background in illustration, art or 3D is a plus



  






 Who you are
 



* A team player who can take initiative and develop solutions
* A problem-solver who can align solutions with client needs
* You have the ability to oversee the process of a project and quality control on design polish
* You treat challenges as opportunities and come at them with an optimistic viewpoint



  





  






 Working at North Kingdom
 




 North Kingdom is the creative arm for Gaming & Entertainment within NoA Ignite.
 



 It's our ambition to be the best workplace in the world. We believe you should use both your passion and mastery in your work, get inspired, feel safe, work hard and have fun. We expect you to be professional, brave, honest and engaged, but most importantly: be You.
 



  






 What you get
 



* Pension contribution
* Private health insurance
* Parental leave top-up
* 5,000 SEK health care allowance
* Flexible work hours



 Are we everything you ever looked for in a workplace? Get in touch! We are meeting applicants on an ongoing basis. There is no need for a personal letter or a CV. Just provide a link to your LinkedIn profile and attach your portfolio. That's it! Next up: if your profile matches what we are looking for, we will reach out to you as soon as possible.

title: Web Content Editor
description:
På Proffsmagasinet strävar vi efter en överlägsen upplevelse för våra kunder, något som också genomsyrar vår arbetsplats och vår kultur. Hos oss blir du en del av något större där vi är övertygande om att tillsammans är bättre än ensam. Gemenskapen hos oss är en av våra framgångsfaktorer och det är vi stolta över. Vill du utvecklas med oss och samtidigt ha den bästa tiden i ditt arbetsliv? Sök till oss idag!
   

  

**Rollbeskrivning**
 Som Web Content Editor arbetar du med berikning av produkter i vår e-handel och bidrar till utveckling av organisationens masterdatahantering. Rollen är huvudsakligen inriktad på arbete med produktinformation och teknisk data men även textproduktion och SEO.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
* Du jobbar på Web Content avdelningen som består av 9 personer och ingår i säljavdelningen som består av ca 25 personer.
* Vi sitter på ett kontor vid Marievik i Liljeholmen.
* Arbetstiderna är kontorstider med flexmöjligheter.


**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**
* Utföra produktberikning och säkerställa att produktdata följer kvalitetsstandarder och riktlinjer.
* Identifiera och åtgärda datafel samt föreslå förbättringar av processer och system.
* Samarbeta med andra avdelningar, såsom SEO, UX och kundupplevelse, för att säkerställa att artikelpresentation uppfyller affärsmålen.
* Delta aktivt i teamets planering och bidra till ett effektivt arbete i agila sprintar.
* Bidra till att utveckla och effektivisera teamets arbetsmetoder samt stödja kollegor.
* Utveckla din tekniska förståelse för system och processer och föreslå strategiska förbättringar.


**Kvalifikationer och erfarenheter** 
 :
   

  

* Kompetens: Stark teknisk förståelse för system, datakvalitet och processer.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i PIM-system och andra relaterade verktyg är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av administrativa uppgifter, gärna inom e-handel och vår bransch.
* Goda kunskaper i Excel.
* God skriftlig förmåga och erfarenhet av säljande produkttexter.


**Personliga egenskaper:**
* Noggrannhet och strukturerat arbetssätt.
* Initiativtagande och vilja att bidra till teamets utveckling.
* Lösningsorienterad, du ser möjligheter när du ställs inför en utmaning.
* En utvecklingsorienterad inställning och förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta med andra avdelningar för att uppnå gemensamma mål.


**Om Proffsmagasinet**
 Genom våra engagerade medarbetare, vägledande kunskap och ett brett sortiment hjälper vi dagligen människor att förverkliga sina hemmadrömmar. På Proffsmagasinet strävar vi inte bara efter en överlägsen kundupplevelse utan också efter en överlägsen medarbetarupplevelse. Som en del i Ahlsell-koncernen utvecklas vi konstant - nya relationer byggs, arbetssätt utvecklas och vi har det himla kul på vägen. Vill du vara med på vår resa mot att bli Sveriges bästa e-handel är vi övertygade om att du kommer att ha den bästa tiden i ditt arbetsliv hos oss.

title: Chief Technology Officer
company_industry: Travel Arrangements, Information Services, and Software Development
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Chief Technology Officer
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (2-3 days per week hybrid)
 



  





**Job Overview**




  





 We are supporting a fast-growing SaaS company in the travel space, building scalable, user-centric solutions that simplify bookings and automate operations. They're looking for a hands-on CTO to lead our technology vision and execution. You’ll own the tech strategy and roadmap, lead the engineering team, and ensure the scalability and reliability of our platform (web & mobile). This is both a strategic and roll-up-your-sleeves role, ideal for someone excited to build and scale a product that matters.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:**




  




* Set and execute the technical vision, aligning with business goals.
* Lead platform development, architecture, and integrations.
* Build and mentor a high-performing engineering team.
* Drive innovation in automation, scalability, and user experience.
* Collaborate with Product, Sales, and Operations on feature priorities.
* Ensure compliance, security, and performance best practices.
* Stay current on travel tech trends, APIs, and standards (e.g., NDC).



  





**Qualifications:**




  




* Previous experience as CTO or senior engineering leader in SaaS.
* Strong technical background in modern web stacks
* Experience with SaaS platforms, cloud infrastructure, and CI/CD.
* Bonus: familiarity with travel industry standards and systems.
* Fluent in English; Swedish is a plus.



  





**How to Apply:** 




  





 Should you find this opportunity compelling and believe your qualifications align with the position, we invite you to kindly forward your resume. Alternatively, you may choose to establish contact with me through LinkedIn or by email at amber.jones@select-tech.co.uk

title: Model prep./Coordinator
job_function: General Business, Management, and Business Development
description:
**Model prep. Coordinator**
 Do you have experience in model prep, from digital models to prepare them for milling and to coordinate the models between different level skills. Also be able to act as a “Scrum master” for a small team.
   

  

 Now is your chance - join our new product and interaction design section within the Scania R&D (BID) organization as a Model preparator / Coordinator at our model workshop. Scania R&D is undergoing a significant transformation as part of the TRATON R&D ecosystem. With the establishment of our new organization as of February 1st 2025, we are now building the foundations for a strong and inclusive community, driving organizational success.
   

  

**Roles And Responsibilities**
 As a Model preparator / Coordinator you will work in our team as a keyperson both to prepare digital models for milling and also to coordinate the job to different skill levels and have the role as a “scrum master” for the team. We are a team with clay modeler, model makers and mill operators, we work close together to support our design department to get physical models in time for our timelines. For our help we have a full modern clay studio and a fullscale clay mill with scanning device.
   

  

**Requirements**
 We believe that the ideal candidate has the following qualifications and experiences:
   

  

  

* Independently prepare Catia models into solid models.
* Responsible that models get prepared for mill preparations.
* Good knowledge, relevant for the role, within the automotive and manufacturing field.
* Committed, creative and driven with an open and flexible approach. High level ability to focus on the right things.
* Experience from automotive conceptual and industrialization work.
* Experience in Catia or other similar CAD systems.
* Experience in Jira
* Good cooperative skills
* Experience and knowledge in property driven project development.
* Fluent English in speech and writing.


 We are looking for demonstrated ability to work in team environments with a highly collaborative mindset. Our day to day work demands an agile attitude, adapting to different ambition levels and project conditions.
   

  

 You should possess the characteristics and capability to work independently and in a team towards project goals and timelines, with a proven ability to handle multiple assignments and tasks.
   

  

 The position is based at Scania Product & Interaction design’s facilities in Södertälje, Sweden.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-07-07. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Jonas Nordlöf, Manager, jonas.nordlof@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

**Education**
* Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent Level 6

title: Engineering Manager in Connectivity & API department | SEB, Stockholm
description:
With technology as our driving force, we provide world-class services to SEB group customers and business divisions in 20 sites worldwide. With us, you'll be part of a dedicated team of over 2800 employees who constantly work towards improving business development and growth. Do you want to work at the interface between ground-breaking technology and a world of financial flows? Welcome to SEB!
   

  

**About The Role**
 Join a dynamic department operating across Sweden and Lithuania, where innovation meets impact. You’ll lead a strategically important unit based in Stockholm, consisting of two agile teams (15 professionals in total) including Scrum Masters, Tech Leads, front- and back-end developers, and UX designer.
   

  

 Your teams are at the forefront of SEB’s API strategy—delivering the API Gateway and platform, and serving as a Centre of Excellence. They provide expert support and guidance to ensure the development of high-quality, standardized internal and external APIs.
   

  

 This unit plays a vital role within the Data, Connectivity & Analytics Tribe, part of the Business Infrastructure Domain.
   

  

**You Will Be Responsible For**
* Developing high-performing teams with outstanding commitment to common goals, mutual trust and respect, clarity around individual roles and responsibilities, and great collaboration.
* Maintaining a healthy IT portfolio of your team from a risk, security, cost, and compliance perspective.
* Hiring new staff, managing performance, coaching and mentoring team members.
* Communicate and closely interact with leading representatives at the different Business functions as well as with managers and architects within Tech.
* Driving SEB’s technical transformation agenda for your team’s portfolio for future proofing applications, data transformations, APIs and our journey to SaaS and cloud.
* Contributing to the department and extended management team.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe**
* You are an engaging leader with a genuine interest in people and technology.
* You are skillful in understanding and building great team dynamics.
* You have solid background in IT infrastructure, software development and operations.
* You have experience in Agile way of working with self-organizing cross functional teams.
* You have good understanding of the product management function and excel in communication and expectation management.
* You are fluent in verbal and written English.


**What We Offer**
* An international and empowering environment with highly skilled colleagues.
* Work-life balance & hybrid way of working.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Friendly and welcoming culture.
* Exciting opportunity to be part of transforming an industry.
* Attractive compensation and benefits.


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 7th of July, 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Inesa Vanpoucke, Department Manager of Connectivity & API by mail inesa.vanpoucke@seb.se.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
description:
**Job Description**
**Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)**
 We are looking for a
 **Strategic Product Manager** 
 who wants to be part of Tietoevry Banking. Tietoevry Banking is the leading financial services software and solution partner in the Nordics. We offer modular, pre-integrated banking as a service solutions and market-leading software for core, payments, credit, cards, financial fraud, and wealth. With our scale, expertise, and specialization, we empower financial institutions to enhance agility, efficiency, and accelerate digital transformation.
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry Banking you will work on:**
* Product Vision and Strategy: Develop and communicate a clear product vision and mid-term/long-term strategy that aligns with the company's overall Strategy, objectives and market trends. Define target customers, licensing and pricing models to address predictable long-term revenue flow. Define complementary services to support successful implementation and maintenance, ensure additional revenue flow.
* Market Analysis: Conduct in-depth market research to understand industry trends, competitive landscape, regulatory changes and customer needs, providing input and recommendations for strategic decisions for mid-term and long-term initiatives. Identify opportunities for product innovation and differentiation.
* Roadmap Development: Ability to translate market needs and business opportunities to a strategic roadmap and balance long/short-term needs. Create and maintain a high-level product roadmap that outlines key milestones, deliverables, and timelines, ensuring alignment with business priorities. Address product lifecycles, including planning sunsetting and migration strategies. Define innovation inception approaches. Plan portfolio modernization to fit market needs, ensure future growth and competitive costs.
* Relationship Building: Establish and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients, partners, and industry influencers to create new business opportunities. Participate, present and be influencer in conferences, industry workgroups. Build relationships with industry stakeholders globally. Demonstrate cultural awareness and the ability to adapt product strategies to various regional requirements.
* Stakeholder management: Collaborate closely with the sales team and engage with other departments, including engineering, marketing, project management and customer teams, to support with sales and ensure successful product development and launch. Cooperate cross-units in Cards and Transaction Banking and other units in Banking.
* Customer Insights: Prepare and present vision, pitches, and presentations to existing and potential clients and partners, effectively communicating the value proposition. Gather and analyze customer feedback and usage data to inform product decisions and enhance user experience.
* Performance Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success and identify areas for improvement, ensure data-based decision making. Keep accountability on product/service profitability. Align models and use cross unit template and processes.
* Go-to-Market Strategy: Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to develop and execute effective go-to-market strategies for product launches and updates. Collaborate with Security, Compliance and Privacy teams to identify market or country potential risks and opportunities.
* Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful product delivery and adoption.
* Leadership and Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to product managers and team members, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.


**Who we are looking for:**
* A Bachelor's degree in business, Marketing, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
* Proven experience in product management, with a focus on strategic planning and execution.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience in Cards and Payments, with a large network of connections with industry experts and decision-makers.
* Familiarity with European and Nordic customers.


**We also believe you have:**
* Strong strategic thinking skills to develop and implement effective product strategies.
* A market and customer focus that drives product innovation and meets customer needs.
* Excellent relationship-building abilities to establish connections with clients, partners, and industry stakeholders.
* Proficiency in public speaking to effectively present ideas and influence audiences.
* Strong negotiation and influencing skills to advocate for product initiatives and secure buy-in.
* A creative mindset that fosters innovation and the development of unique solutions.
* A results-oriented approach that emphasizes accountability and achievement of product goals.


 As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us. Technology is developing fast, so learning new cutting-edge technologies is something you strive to do.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, an open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance!
* We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
* Competitive salary (up to 7,000 EUR gross per month in Latvia), based on experience and qualifications.
* Finally, we believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.


**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application! Interviews will be held continuously, so we encourage you to apply today! For more information or questions, please contact the Talent Acquisition team at recruitmentinbanking@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

 Location: Rīga - Verde, Roberta Hirša 1
   

  

*On specific positions, we might perform background checks.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion, and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiarize yourself with what we do.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.
   

  

 Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Kravanalytiker/Business Analyst till bank
description:
**Uppdragsbeskrivning**
 Vi söker en erfaren kravanalytiker för uppdrag inom IT-utveckling. Konsulten kommer att arbeta i nära samarbete med verksamheten, UX-designers, utvecklingsteam, produktägare och andra intressenter för att säkerställa att krav tas fram, analyseras, dokumenteras och förankras på ett strukturerat och effektivt sätt. Målet är att bidra till framgångsrika leveranser av digitala lösningar med hög kvalitet och användarnytta.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Analys av nuläge och behov kring önskat framtida läge. Facilitering av workshops och möten med verksamhet och IT. Dokumentation av funktionella och icke-funktionella krav i form av t.ex. user stories, processer och annan kravdokumentation.
   

  

 Stödja utvecklingsteamet med kravförtydliganden under hela utvecklingscykeln.
   

  

 Delta i prioritering av krav tillsammans med produktägare och andra intressenter.
   

  

 Identifiera beroenden, risker och konsekvenser kopplat till krav och förändringar.
   

  

**Skallkrav**
* Minst 3–5 års erfarenhet som kravanalytiker i IT-projekt.
* God erfarenhet av att arbeta med agila utvecklingsmetoder
* Vana vid kravhantering i verktyg som Jira och Confluence
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med både tekniska och verksamhetsnära krav.
* God kommunikationsförmåga i tal och skrift på svenska
* Erfarenhet från bank/finans eller liknande regelverksstyrd verksamhet


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Strukturerad och analytisk med förmåga att se helhet och detaljer.
* Självgående med god samarbetsförmåga.
* Nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och van att driva frågor framåt.


**Start:** 
 1 september
   

  

**Längd:** 
 6 månader
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 100%
   

  

**Språk:** 
 Svenska/Engelska
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Stockholm (möjlighet till remote 1-2 dagar i veckan)

title: Senior SEO Specialist
description:
📍Stockholm
   

  

 📆 As soon as possible
   

  

 👩🏽‍💻 Office: 3 Days a Week
   

  

 📚 Our Recruitment Process
   

  

 At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.
   

  

 Are you curious to learn more about us? Read more about us here. For insights into what life is like at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.
   

  

*We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.*
**About The Role**
 A Senior SEO Specialist is a SEO expert, developing and implementing impactful SEO tactics and clear outcomes in client collaborations. With deep technical and operational knowledge, this role drives innovation, initiating continuous testing and optimisation, and conducting thorough analysis to derive actionable insights. In collaboration with clients and team members, the Senior SEO Specialist addresses complex challenges with SEO-specific expertise, transforming them into solutions that contribute to the overarching strategic direction. Integral to the role is the ability to share knowledge and maintain a standard of SEO excellence within the team.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead the tactical & operational management within SEO, ensuring flawless execution and detailed performance analysis in client collaborations.
* Direct advanced testing and optimisation initiatives within SEO, applying deep expertise to enhance effectiveness and meet client KPIs.
* Conduct in-depth SEO analysis and audits to identify opportunities for improving brand strength and performance metrics in organic and AI generated search.
* Advocate for and execute on cross-solution synergy projects to impact overall client performance (e.g. paid and organic media or SEO and CRO).
* Manage commercial activities that contribute to the growth of the SEO business.
* Provide clients with concise, actionable recommendations based on data-driven insights, advising and consulting on strategic decisions that connect to the broader client objectives.
* Promote a collaborative environment, leading by example in integrating SEO-specific insights with cross-functional team efforts to enhance the overall client experience and success.
* Facilitate knowledge sharing & mentor other specialists, providing guidance on SEO-specific tactics and fostering an environment of continuous learning.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Deep knowledge of all three pillars of SEO (Technical, Content & Authority) as well as LLM optimisation, and how they integrate with and impact the overall marketing strategies.
* Excellent hands-on proficiency in utilising SEO tools & platforms (e.g. Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog or similar) to tailor SEO strategies for brand and performance objectives.
* Advanced technical acumen in diagnosing and solving complex SEO-related issues, ensuring high-quality operations and tactical integrity.
* Ability to analyse and interpret data across both SEO & analytics platforms (e.g. GA4) and use insights to drive continuous optimisation and achieve better outcomes.
* Proficiency in crafting and applying effective testing tactics to discover innovative solutions and boost overall SEO efforts.
* A high level of commercial awareness and a track record of financial growth.
* Experienced in communicating complex ideas clearly, both in presentations and through collaborative discussions.
* Strong mentoring skills, with a focus on sharing knowledge and fostering a learning environment within the team.
* Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g. Looker Studio) and ability to present insights in an engaging and understandable manner.
* In addition to your specialisation in SEO, you should remain comfortable with CRO / UX strategies and tactics and be able to drive initiatives towards clients.


**What We Offer**
*You can read our full offering in our* 
*handbook.*
* An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
* A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
* Transparent salary setting, you can find all our salary bands in our handbook. This role is an L3 role within the Media, Client & SEO/CRO column. Check it out!
* 30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
* A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.


**We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.**

title: Solution Design Team Lead - Digital Operations
description:
**About The Role**
**Digital Operations** 
 :
   

  

 Digital Operations is a new organisation optimising OSTTRA's derivative processing operations through automation and advanced technology. Operating with a startup mindset, cross-regional presence, and a flat structure, our mission is to minimise manual effort across the firm and our clients, automate repetitive tasks, generate data-driven client insights, and drive product development for enhanced automation. The key lead roles for the organisation are Solution Design Team Lead, Development Team Lead and Senior Solutions Architect, and the organisation will work independently and self-sustained.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 The Solution Design Team Lead is a critical role within the organisation, responsible for leading a team of Solution Designers and AI Engineers. This team owns the analysis, design and implementation of technology-driven solutions that optimise OSTTRA’s processes and operations. This includes optimising client resource usage, user experience, and, ultimately, the value clients gain from Osttra’s products and services. By enhancing client-facing processes and optimising internal workflows, the Solution Design Team Lead directly contributes to improved client time and cost efficiency, while maximising the overall value delivered by OSTTRA. Besides managing the team and driving the analysis and design of technological solutions, the role also involves collaborating with diverse stakeholders, including product development teams, product managers, operations teams, and senior leadership.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Operational Analysis and Process Optimisation: Conduct in-depth analyses of client service workflows, particularly within Salesforce, to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, manual processes, and areas ripe for automation and self-service solutions. Collaborate closely with operations teams to understand current challenges and define data-driven solutions. Analyse historical support cases to identify trends and recurring issues, informing optimisation strategies.
* Cross-Functional Solution Design and Optimisation: Partner with product development teams and product managers to design and specify technology solutions that optimise identified operational needs. This includes contributing to the design and enhancement of both central solutions and product-specific features and services. Develop detailed specifications and documentation to guide technology implementation, ensuring alignment with product and business strategy. Advocate for product improvements that drive client value and operational efficiency.
* Independent Solution Design and Implementation Oversight: Lead the design and implementation of end-to-end solutions, from concept to deployment, focusing on optimisation of processes and outcomes. Collaborate with senior leadership to define solution scope, objectives, and key performance indicators (KPIs). Coordinate with relevant teams to ensure seamless integration and execution. Analyse solution performance post-implementation, iterating as needed to achieve optimal results and demonstrating return on investment.
* Team Leadership and Mentorship: Manage and mentor a team of Solution Designers and AI Engineers, providing guidance, fostering professional development, and ensuring effective team collaboration.


**Qualifications**
* Master degree in Industrial Management or similar discipline
* 5-7 years of relevant experience but not necessarily prior experience as a team lead, as we see this as a potential first opportunity to be a leader.
* A strong background in finance, statistics, or a related field, combined with a demonstrated interest in technology and its application within financial services.
* Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify patterns, extract insights from data, and develop effective optimisation strategies.
* Experience in a product design, business analysis, or similar role focused on solution development, implementation, and process optimisation.
* Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and senior leadership.
* Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and results-driven with a commitment to continuous learning and improvement.
* Project management experience, a process-oriented mindset, and experience with change management practices.
* A foundational understanding of technology, including AI technology, automation tools, and software development processes.


**Reporting Structure** 
 : This position reports to the Digital Operations Platform Delivery Lead
   

  

**Division** 
 : Technology
   

  

**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Recruitment Fraud Alert**
 If you receive an email from a spglobalind.com domain or any other regionally based domains, it is a scam and should be reported to reportfraud@spglobal.com. S&P Global never requires any candidate to pay money for job applications, interviews, offer letters, “pre-employment training” or for equipment/delivery of equipment. Stay informed and protect yourself from recruitment fraud by reviewing our guidelines, fraudulent domains, and how to report suspicious activity here.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp\_%20English\_formattedESQA508c.pdf

title: Founding SW Engineer, Full Stack
description:
**Founding SW Engineer - Full Stack** 




  





**Role Description** 




 We are looking for a Founding Software Engineer (full-stack, with more gravitation towards front), located in Stockholm. The role involves developing and maintaining both front-end and back-end components of web applications, designing robust and scalable software architecture, coding, testing, and debugging software.
 



 You will collaborate with colleagues in Data Science and AI/ML, and GTM to build the best possible solutions and products and report to our CPTO.
 



  





**Your Qualifications** 



* Strong foundations in Computer Science and an eye for world-class UX-driven design
* Understanding in Back-End Web Development and Software Engineering (SWE)
* Expertise in Programming languages and development frameworks
* Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
* Strong written and verbal communication skills (English)
* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field; advanced degrees are a plus
* Experience and interest in AI enablements/productivity, agentic workflows



  





**Cultural fit** 




 Team player spirit, curiosity for new areas, the ability to gain new skills, and a love for data/AI helps. We mainly work on-site for quick communication flow, but remote work can work to some degree.
 



 We are looking for commitment, ownership and agency, hence prefer full-time employment over consulting-assignments for this role
 



  





**Why Join Redpine?** 



* Be part of a cutting-edge company shaping the future of AI-driven data monetization.
* Work in a global-first, AI-native environment with industry-leading professionals.
* Enjoy a competitive base salary with significant equity upside.
* Engage with top-tier partners across AI, finance, telecom, public sector, and defense tech.



  





 Join Redpine.ai and help us build the foundation for tomorrow’s AI.
 



 Send us your application at careers@redpine.ai

title: It-arkitekt
description:
Inera är ett digitaliseringsbolag som bidrar till att utveckla välfärden. Vi är Sveriges digitala ingång till hälsa, vård och omsorg och utvecklar digital infrastruktur för en sammanhållen välfärd. Vi arbetar på uppdrag av kommuner och regioner. Vår vision är världens mest innovativa och omtänksamma välfärd.



För att kunna upprätthålla hög kvalitet inom hälsa, vård och omsorg måste välfärden utvecklas, med oförändrade eller minskade resurser. Genom digitalisering – att förändra strukturer, beteenden och arbetssätt med stöd av digital teknik – kan flera av välfärdens utmaningar mötas. Det gör Ineras uppdrag viktigare än någonsin.


**Om rollen**



Nu söker vi en it-arkitekt som vill stärka vårt stöd till Sveriges kommuner i deras resa mot ökad digitalisering – med målet att skapa ett ökat stöd för invånarna. Som it-arkitekt på Inera blir du en del av ett team som arbetar för att ta fram långsiktiga och effektiva lösningar för landets 290 kommuner. Vi står inför gemensamma samhällsutmaningar - med strama budgetar och begränsade resurser - vilket innebär att samordnade nationella lösningar, gemensamma principer och infrastruktur behöver vara en del av lösningen. Du tillhör It-avdelningen och sektionen för Samverkansarkitektur och Integrationer. Sektionen har kompetenser inom it- och samverkansarkitektur, integration samt informationsarkitektur.



Hos oss arbetar du agilt i en SAFe-inspirerad miljö, i nära samarbete med kollegor från olika delar av organisationen. Vi har högt i tak och uppmuntrar både egna initiativ och samarbete – vi tror att innovation växer där idéer får utrymme.


**Är det här du?**



Vi söker dig som har en relevant högskoleutbildning och tidigare erfarenheter av digitalisering inom kommunal sektor. Det är en fördel om du har en god förståelse för kommunal verksamhet och de villkor och förutsättningar som kommuner verkar inom. Det är också en fördel om du har övergripande kunskap om it- och informationssäkerhet.



Det är meriterande om du har följande erfarenheter eller kunskap:


* Erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete i eller med kommunal sektor, gärna informations-, verksamhets-, lösnings- eller enterprisearkitekt.
* Kunskap om och erfarenhet av informatik och interoperabilitet.
* Certifiering inom arkitektur från erkända utbildningsinstitut (till exempel Dataföreningen kompetens)
* Övergripande kunskap kring it- och informationssäkerhet.
* Flerårig erfarenhet av kommunal verksamhet och dess olika verksamhetsområden, gärna skola eller socialtjänst samt organisationens styrmekanismer.
* Erfarenhet av standardiseringsarbete, särskilt kopplat till informationsutbyte.
* Kunskap om och erfarenhet av identitets och behörighetshantering.

### **Varaktighet och tillträde**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstidens slut.


**Vill du veta mer?**


* Susanne Nee Schill, susanne.nee.schill@inera.se
* Peter Mannerhagen, peter.mannerhagen@inera.se


*Fackliga frågor (Vision), Monica Rosén, 072-724 32 81*

title: Administratör/systemförvaltare
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
--------------------


Skurups kommun har drygt 17 000 invånare och ligger naturskönt på den skånska sydkusten, med utmärkta kommunikationer till Malmö, Ystad, Lund och Köpenhamn. I vår kommun bor invånarna i lugnet, med staden runt knuten. Det lokala näringslivet blomstrar och inflyttningen till kommunen ökar.
  

  

1 200 medarbetare håller dagligen hjulen snurrande, med fullt engagemang för medborgarnas bästa. Hos oss är du med och bygger en attraktiv kommun där dialog, öppenhet och gott bemötande genomsyrar organisationen. Vi är stolta över våra korta beslutsvägar. Tillsammans gör vi skillnad!
  

  

Skurups vision 2045: Med hjärta och engagemang för livskvalitet, trygghet och utveckling skapar vi platsen där vi lever, verkar och växer tillsammans. Skurups kommun är platsen för det goda livet.
  

  

Är du en strukturerad och kommunikativ administratör med gedigen erfarenhet från en politiskt styrd organisation? Brinner du för att leverera högkvalitativ service och har en stark digital kompetens? Då kan du vara den vi söker till Skol- och utbildningsförvaltningen i Skurup.
  

  

Vi erbjuder en spännande och ansvarsfull roll i en dynamisk kommunal verksamhet i Skurup med förmåner som friskvårdsersättning, förmånscykel och möjlighet till flextider.


**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------


I rollen som administratör/handläggare kommer du att spela en central roll i vår verksamhet. Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden inkluderar:
  

* Diarieföring: Ansvara för effektiv och korrekt hantering av inkommande och utgående handlingar i samverkan
* Avtalshantering: Säkerställa korrekt upprättande, registrering och uppföljning av avtal.
* Klagomålshantering: Hantera och dokumentera inkomna klagomål på ett professionellt och lösningsorienterat sätt.
* Systemförvaltning: Aktivt bidra till och ansvara för förvaltning och utveckling av relevanta verksamhetssystem.
* Sekreteraruppgifter: Vara sekreterare vid olika möten och forum, vilket inkluderar att förbereda underlag, skriva protokoll och följa upp beslut.
* Stödja kollegor och chefer med administrativa uppgifter på avancerad nivå.
* Leda utvecklingsarbetet och vara ett stöd för kommunens skoladministratörer
* Utarbeta rutiner och strukturer för administrativa processer.
  

**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Vi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter, gärna inom en kommunal eller regional verksamhet. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du:
  

* Har erfarenhet av diarieföring, avtalshantering och klagomålshantering.
* Har god digital kompetens och känner dig bekväm med att arbeta i och förvalta olika IT-system.
* Har dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta i en politiskt styrd organisation och förstår dess processer och förutsättningar.
* Är flexibel och kan snabbt anpassa dig till nya situationer och arbetsuppgifter.
* Är ansvarstagande och tar ett stort ägarskap för dina arbetsuppgifter.
* Är mycket serviceinriktad med ett gott bemötande i alla kontakter.
* Är skicklig i tal och skrift på svenska och kan kommunicera komplext innehåll på ett klart och tydligt sätt.
* Har förmåga att arbeta självständigt såväl som i team.

**Anställningens omfattning**
-----------------------------


Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning

  

Omfattning: Heltid

  

Tillträde: 2025-09-01  

eller enligt överenskommelse.


**Ansökan**
-----------


Ansök senast: 2025-07-20


Referensnummer: A1371693

  

**Anställning**
---------------


Antal annonserade arbetstillfällen: 1

  

**Kontakt**
-----------


### **Kontaktperson**


Ulrika Fridh  

Bitr. förvaltningschef  

0411-53 62 04  


### **Facklig företrädare**


Fackliga företrädare nås via kommunens växel  

0411-53 60 00  

**Övrigt**
----------


För att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsprocessen i Skurups kommun samt möjliggöra god kommunikation med våra sökande ber vi dig skicka in din ansökan digitalt och inte via e-post eller pappersformat.
  

  

Har du beslut om skyddad identitet, kontakta rekryterande chef innan du ansöker till tjänsten.
  

  

Tjänsten tillsätts under förutsättning att erforderliga beslut fattas.
  

  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
  

  

Inför rekryteringsarbetet har Skurups kommun tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanbeder oss därför bestämt kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.

title: Forma framtidens flygplan – Arbeta med Systemutveckling för Gripen
description:
*Vi tror att framsteg och möjligheter skapas bäst tillsammans. Välkommen till en plats där samarbete gör skillnad.*

Din roll


I denna roll kommer du att arbeta i ett mindre team med kompetenta kollegor och utveckla nya funktioner i stridsflygplanet Gripen C/D.


De funktioner som utvecklas av dig och ditt team kommer att ha många gränssnitt mot andra delar av flygplanet vilket ger dig möjlighet att få en god övergripande förståelse för de olika komplexa systemen i Gripen. Detta kommer att vara en bra bas för din framtida utveckling och karriär på Saab.


I ditt arbete kommer du kontinuerligt att utveckla din expertis, både genom utbildning och kompetensöverföring från erfarna kollegor.


Den del i vår moderna utvecklingsmiljö som du kommer vara en del av, kommer du att vara en del av hela utvecklingskedjan, t.ex. definition av krav, modellering, design och verifiering i flygsimulatorer. Ditt arbetsinnehåll och framtida utveckling kommer att bero på din erfarenhet och intresse och naturligtvis företagets framtida behov.

*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*


Din profil


Vi söker individer som gillar att samarbeta på ett nyfiket och ödmjukt sätt med god kommunikation. Du har också god förmåga att fatta egna beslut och initiativ i ditt dagliga arbete. Dessutom värdesätter vi din strävan att bidra med nya idéer i ditt arbete för att utveckla både teknik och arbetssätt.


Skallkrav:

* Högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen inom systemutveckling, datateknik eller motsvarande område
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom systemutveckling
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


Vi tror även du tar ansvar och har en god förmåga att arbeta med olika personligheter och sprida positiv energi inom teamet. Du har också en pedagogisk förmåga att utbilda mindre erfarna och förstå vikten av att informera andra. Tidigare Saab-erfarenhet är meriterande.


Vad du blir en del av


Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.


Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.


Kontaktinformation: Om du har frågor angående tjänsten, kontakta Victoria Posluk, rekryteringschef: +46 13184788
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Senior Software Engineer - COTS Area
description:
Applications are considered on a rolling basis Linköping Hybrid
  
  

We are now looking for a Senior Software engineer to join our COTS (Commercial Off the Shelf) area, where we develop and maintain the ACU6-Pro OH platform – a robust, market-ready solution used by a wide variety of customers across different sectors. We specialize in combining robust platform development with flexible customer adaptation.
  
  

We have just started the development of our next generation telematic platform, and are now looking for experienced engineers to join our team.
  
  

In our COTS area, you will join a team which includes a number of highly skilled engineers, all sharing the same goal – developing the utmost reliable and secure product for our customers.
  
  

Examples of recent projects the team has accomplished is developing a connectivity platform for electric motorcycles, and a ruggedized gateway for the agriculture sector.
  
  

Arvid Trygg
  
Software Development Engineer
  
"At ACTIA, you are never stuck alone with a problem. Everybody wants to help you succeed in your work. That is for me a huge advantage when it comes to developing the best solutions"
  
Kais Trabelsi
  
SW Line Manager
  
"Here, you have the opportunity to influence all decisions made. We are close to the management, you can express your opinions freely and it is a workplace culture with friendly, respectful colleagues."
  
Skills & Requirements
  
  

For this position, we are looking for someone with the following background:
  
  

* At least 5 years of relevant experience from embedded software development.
* Avid programming skills in C and C++.
* A degree in engineering. Preferably computer science, applied physics, electrical engineering or similar.


**As a person, you should be:**  

* A team player.
* An avid problem solver.
* Innovative and passionate about coding.
* Eager to learn new things. Excited to take on new challenges.


Full-spectrum development. From SW to HW
  
  

In-house production. Full insight and control
  
  

Workplace flexibility. Hybrid work set-up
  
  

High-profile clients – global well-known brands
  
  

Company health care and health insurance
  
  

Flat organization. Collaborate and innovate freely
  
  

About the company
  
  

Welcome to the technology leader in connectivity
  
ACTIA’s products are used in millions of applications worldwide, mainly in the automotive industry. We are a part of the global ACTIA Group, but our workplace culture is characterized by the closeness, innovativeness and flexibility of a smaller company. As an employee at ACTIA, you have the opportunity to work with world-leading technology in the entire chain from software, to hardware, production and ancillary services. It provides a valuable and exciting overall perspective where you can see every technical detail develop together with your colleagues. We are looking for everybody who is attracted by challenging, forefront technology, and who have high expectations for both your own and your workplace's development.
  
  

Our Core Values
  
  

Care
  
The wellbeing of people and environment is important to us and we make long-term sustainable choices.
  
  

Courage
  
We empower each other and seek opportunities to develop both individuals and as a company.
  
  

Dedication
  
We take a genuine interest in our client’s business and strive for excellence together.
  
  

Trust
  
We create safe and efficient technology that both our customers and society can rely on.
  
  

Oscar Bentevik Holm | Contact Person
