title: Engineering Manager (Front-End/ Full Stack) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Front-End Department builds the Agoda web and app products. We have several teams in front-end focusing on different aspects of our products including accommodations, flights, payments, marketing, post-booking services, and more. Agoda’s marketplace is the world. We build localized and optimized user experiences at scale on every major internet platform. These include our mobile websites, native apps, and desktop sites. We hire people from around the world who have a passion for using technology to create and implement the best user experiences. Our teams work on the full stack and build end-to-end systems including user interfaces, APIs, backend systems, and database systems. Our products are always evolving and under experimentation. We accomplish this by having an amazing degree of automation, CI/CD systems, and use a modularized approach. As we are data driven and measure our results, we continually innovate and improve our work. We are looking for the next great talent who strives to learn and grow and has a standard of excellence, strong sense of ownership, and great technical skills.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 We are looking hands-on Development Managers who have unique knowledge and abilities to contribute to our highly scaled web products and mobile applications. You must be a strong leader who can guide our staff beyond our already high standards of engineering to the next level.
   

  

 The manager roles at Agoda are some of the most significant and challenging roles at the company. The right candidate is both extremely hands on – technically excellent, with solid engineering principles – and exhibits strong leadership and people development skills. We are looking for world class managers to lead one or more of our engineering teams.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Maintain ownership and responsibility of mission critical systems.
* Guide one or more Agile teams to success.
* Get involved with full stack, server, and mobile app engineering and guide server, client, and infrastructure technical staff to the best solutions.
* Directly manage between 5 and 10 technology professionals and be responsible for their performance at the company.


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* At least 3 years of experience managing engineering teams of 3 people and more, 5+ years of experience in software engineering
* Proficient with web client-side technologies (React, Redux. state management, javascript, SASS, Performance optimization)
* Proficient in one or more mobile platforms (iOS, Android, Web)
* Extremely proficient in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Java, Kotlin, Scala, C#)
* Knowledge in scale, microservices and clean architecture
* Extremely proficient in modern mobile and server coding and design practices, e.g., SOLID principals and TDD
* Excellent people management and communication skills
* B.S. in Computer Science or quantitative field; M.S. preferred


**It’s Great if you have:**
* Deep experience in multiple platforms including Web, iOS, Android and API services
* Have managed teams and been a key player at an Internet company that is at scale with large numbers of users and transactions per second
* Have experience managing in a data driven company with experience analyzing and working with Big Data
* Created new teams and greenfield projects solving large system problems
* Previously worked with VP or Senior leadership at a large company
* Worked on global projects serving world markets with distributed data centers and localization of the front end and data


**#sanjose #losangeles #sydney #melbourne #perth #brussels #saopaolo #vancouver #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #copenhagen #helsinki #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #dublin #telaviv #milan #tokyo #kualalumpur #amsterdam #oslo #jerusalem #manila #moscow #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #istanbul #london #wroclaw #warsaw #rio #chennai #pune #toronto #austin #sydney #chichago #noida #delhi #seattle #hyderabad #gurgaon #newyork #bangalore #boston #bengaluru #berlin #mumbai #stockholm #barcelona #IT #4 #5**
**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Security and Privacy Lead - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
**Job Description**
**At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**
**About Us**
 Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.
   

  

 We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from intensive care to laboratory and social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As the Security and Privacy Lead at Tietoevry Care, you will ensure our products and services fulfill security and privacy related requirements, support different teams with their security and privacy related matters as well as create security and privacy frameworks and principles to be shared across our unit. You will lead the design of a security and privacy driven strategy for our diverse healthcare IT product portfolio. You will closely follow the direction of Nordic healthcare (public organizations and authorities) and ensure our security and privacy policies are aligned with the requirements.
   

  

 Your main goal will be to ensure the security, privacy and robustness of our solutions while aligning them with industry standards and best practices. You will set clear security and privacy related goals, ensuring teams are accountable for delivering high-quality, secure, and scalable solutions. You will have the main responsibility for all security and privacy related matters in our unit.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with different architects, development teams, development managers and product management.
   

  

**In this role you will:**
* Work together with the Tietoevry Care Security & Privacy experts to define and follow-up alignment to relevant security and privacy frameworks and policies
* Ensure security and privacy are aligned with our strategy
* Create frameworks, principles and policies that will support our development teams
* Ensure compliance, legislation and regulation related requirements are followed
* Assist with security and privacy related audits
* Create policies and controls for security and privacy related matters
* Execute threat modelling and risk assessment for our portfolio
* Lead security architecture and support our architects with security and privacy related matters


**We are looking for someone with:**
* Proven experience with Secure by Design and Privacy by Design principles in software development, ensuring security and privacy are embedded from the start.
* Strong knowledge of relevant directives, legislation, and regulation, especially within the Nordic healthcare sector (e.g. GDPR, NIS2, national healthcare data laws).
* Hands-on technical expertise to support development teams in resolving security and privacy issues, including threat modelling and risk assessments.
* Demonstrated ability to create and lead security and privacy strategies, including defining goals, frameworks, and accountability models across product portfolios.
* In-depth understanding of relevant standards and frameworks such as NIST, CIS, ISO 27001, DPIA, and familiarity with executing or supporting audits and assessments.


**It would be beneficial if you also have the following:**
* Knowledge in healthcare regulation, requirements, standards and protocols
* Knowledge in Microsoft technologies and solutions such as Azure, Windows Server, .NET Framework, ASP.NET, SQL Server, ASP.NET Core etc.


**What’s in it for you?**
 With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
   

  

 Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host an annual ‘Keep Learning Week’, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.
   

  

**Could you be our new colleague?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager Daniel Westerlund (daniel.m.westerlund@tietoevry.com)
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
*Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.*
*Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.*
 Additional Information
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.
   

  

 Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Senior HR Business Partner
description:
Are you an experienced HR generalist who thrives on both strategic impact and hands-on delivery? At TUI, we’re in the midst of an exciting business and cultural transformation – and we’re looking for a Senior HR Business Partner to lead and shape this journey in the Nordic markets.
   

  

 You’ll take the lead on HR across the Nordic region, working closely with local leaders to drive impactful people initiatives. While you’ll have full ownership of the region, you won’t be doing it alone. You’ll be a key player and trusted partner to Head of HR, and part of a collaborative, international People & Culture team. Alongside you, there’s support from local experts in Talent Acquisition, Compensation & Benefits, and People Advisors – all ready to share expertise and make things happen together.
   

  

 This is a broad, high-impact role where you’ll cover the full employee lifecycle – from organisational development and talent planning to labour relations, performance and cultural transformation – combining strategic influence with hands-on delivery.
   

  

 The role will be published until
 **29th of June.**
**About Our Offer**
* Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, discretionary bonus schemes, generous travel benefits, extensive health & well-being support, and more.
* Flexible working: We encourage a healthy work-life balance with a dynamic working environment.
* A career to shape: Access the TUI Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
* Broaden your network: We champion intercultural collaboration and provide opportunities to work on global projects and teams.
* Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation.


**About The Job**
* Own and deliver the People Plan for the Nordic region, aligning closely with business needs and long-term goals.
* Act as a strategic advisor and coach to senior leaders, providing guidance on leadership, people development, team effectiveness, and organisational design.
* Lead HR operations locally – including performance and talent management, employee relations, labour law compliance, and hands-on day-to-day HR support for managers.
* Be a key player in our transformation – enabling cultural evolution, behavioural change, and organisational growth in line with our global vision.
* Build and execute engagement, wellbeing, and DEI initiatives tailored to the local context.
* Partner closely with our international HR teams to ensure consistency, share best practices, and contribute to global HR initiatives.
* Drive continuous improvement through data insights, performance metrics, and clear business alignment.


**About You**
* You have extensive experience in HR, with a strong track record of delivering both strategic impact and operational excellence in broad generalist roles.
* A true HR generalist, confident in managing the full HR scope, from performance and succession planning to labour law and organisational change.
* Experience working in a matrix or international environment and are comfortable navigating complexity and ambiguity.
* You’re a self-starter – proactive, structured, and accountable – able to lead in a standalone role with high ownership.
* Proven experience in change management and organisational transformation and are passionate about building future-ready teams and cultures.
* Strong communicator and relationship-builder, able to collaborate, challenge constructively, and influence outcomes — with the confidence to manage a wide range of stakeholders across functions, levels, and markets.
* Bring a strong business mindset and a deep understanding of how people strategy connects to business performance. You’re confident in translating commercial needs into impactful HR actions that drive results.
* Comfortable working with data and insights to support decision-making, and you’re curious about how tools like AI can enhance HR practices, performance analysis, and employee experience.
* Fluent in Swedish and English (spoken and written); additional Nordic languages are a plus.


 From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.
   

  

 We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments, so if you require any support, please do let us know.

title: Experienced Accountant, Accounts Receivable
description:
* Application Deadline: June 27, 2025
* Hybrid


**Job Description**
 Oriola is a health and wellbeing company operating in the Nordic countries. We are driven by our purpose, Health for life and we have set ambitious sustainability targets to support wellbeing of people, society, and planet. To ensure this, our business keeps evolving. We are growing and developing within health and wellbeing and developing our services. Our significant role in society gives a great purpose for working with us. In return, we expect you to aim as high as we do. You will need to be customer oriented and proactive. Together we work towards an even healthier future.
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are seeking a skilled Accountant with extensive experience from Accounts Receivables to join our OFSS (Oriola Financial Shared Services). The OFSS team consist of team members working with AP, AR and GL & Reporting. As an Accountant for the accounts receivables, you will play an important role in the Oriola´s accounts receivable processes, where you also work together and support the other team members.
   

  

**Skills & Requirements**
**Personal and experience Requirements**
* Experience from an equivalent role and/or three years of university education with financial specialization or higher education program with emphasis in finance and accounting.
* Experience from working with accounts receivable ledgers (reconciliation of related balance sheet accounts) in terms of reminders and collections work, credit control, bank payment postings and month end closing activities.
* Proven social skills to handle business partners and collaborators within the company
* Be driven and able to progress on work tasks. Ability to improvement projects
* Good knowledge in Excel and other several IT systems
* Being flexible in terms of business and operational changes
* Good communication skills and knowledge in English, both in writing and in speech


**We Offer You**
* Meaningful work in purpose driven organisation, Health for life
* Great team spirit and fun colleagues from Sweden and Finland
* Interesting forward leaning organisation with high ambitious for sustainability
* Organisation which gives independency and responsibility to develop Organisation with Scandinavian view and some travelling
* Interesting business in the middle of the health industry from B2B service business to B2C customer relations.


**Terms Of Employment**
* This is a full-time position, and we want you to start as soon as possible.
* This position is based in Stockholm, Kungsholmen
* The Employment is within the Oriola Group – below you can read about our great company


**Application:** 
 If you feel this is your next career step, please send your application, CV and salary expectation in English no later than 2024-06-27. We will start recruitment interviews with the applicable candidates already during the application period. We hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

**Contact**
 For further information, please contact Alf Asplund (Head of OFSS Sweden)

title: Senior Value & Access Manager
description:
**Overview**
 Senior Payer Value and Patient Access Manager – Nordics & Baltics
   

  

 at Kyowa Kirin International plc
   

  

 Stockholm, Sweden (hybrid position)
   

  

**WE PUSH THE BOUNDARIES OF MEDICINE.**
**LEAPING FORWARD TO MAKE PEOPLE SMILE**
 At Kyowa Kirin International (KKI), our purpose is to make people smile. This means more than drug discovery and development; it is about embedding care into everything we do to make a difference every day for those that need it most. We’re an inclusive pharmaceutical company that takes time to understand what really matters to our patients, their families, and their healthcare professionals, helping our people to take bold actions that deliver life-changing solutions sooner. Our culture is rooted in our values: Teamwork, Commitment to Life, Innovation, and Integrity. They help us to push boundaries to deliver extraordinary impact and make KKI a brilliant place to work.
   

  

**Job Purpose:**
 The role requires a subject matter expert on regional and national Health Technology Assessments (HTA)/reimbursement submissions, pricing solutions and responses to HTA agency questions for each rare disease product, are high quality, strategically aligned and optimised to support access and reimbursement. This role is accountable for both launch and early pipeline products.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Key Responsibilities:**
* Demonstrate expert knowledge on Payer Value and Patient Access, pricing and reimbursement for Nordics and Baltics
* Lead governmental engagement plans cross-functionally with public affairs manager/director supporting the region
* Lead development of HTA submissions to obtain successful recommendations nationally by working closely with internal stakeholders
* Work closely cross-functionally to drive reimbursement submissions and implement public affairs plans for Nordics and Baltics
* Lead pricing negotiations with national or regional authorities with relevant value strategy across the rare disease portfolio
* Cross-functionally working with medical function on evidence generation plans for the region
* Deliver health economic and real-world evidence data collection, analyses (including models) and support to articulate the products value to payers


**Qualifications**
**Position Requirements:**
* Proven experience in leading Payer Value and Patient Access initiatives in industry
* Very good understanding of the Payer Value and Patient Access environment, mainly in Sweden and Finland and payer needs
* Strong HTA submission background with Nordics HTA agencies (TLV etc.)
* Governmental engagement experience within the region
* Strong strategic commercial insight through developing national Payer Value and Patient Access strategies in the pharmaceutical industry
* Health Economics background
* Extensive and up to date knowledge of the local healthcare environment regulations, policies and procedures


 Kyowa Kirin International is an equal opportunities employer.
   

  

 No agencies please.

title: Senior Data Architect, Data and AI - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
**Job Description**
**Senior Data Architect - Tietoevry Care, Data and AI**
**At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**
**About Us**
 Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.
   

  

 We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from intensive care to laboratory and social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.
   

  

 In Tietoevry Care’s Data & AI unit we are reshaping Nordic healthcare and welfare services by providing our customers with advanced data-driven applications, AI solutions and cloud data platforms. Our Data & AI team consists of high-end professionals working in data science, data engineering, data advisory, cloud solutions, security and software development. We are a growing international team of talented, continuously improving experts. With us you get to work with latest technologies, innovative products and create wellbeing for the Nordic societies.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a
 **Senior Data Architect** 
 with a passion for data to join our team. In this role, you will take a leading position in designing, implementing, and orchestrating advanced data and analytics solutions for the healthcare, welfare, and life science sectors in Sweden.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities will include:**
* Collaborating closely with our customers to understand and analyze their requirements, ensuring that our solutions meet their expectations and deliver significant value and benefits to patients.

* Good written and oral communication skills in English, fluency in Swedish is mandatory.
* Mindset for continuous learning and professional growth.


**It would be great bonus if you also had:**
* Experience in modern software engineering and software product development, particularly in distributed organizations.
* Understanding of data governance, security, compliance, and privacy regulations within Sweden and the EU.
* Knowledge of major big data solutions including Databricks, Synapse Analytics, Kafka, and Delta Lake.

title: Växeltelefonist | Statlig myndighet | Stockholm
description:
Vi söker en engagerad och serviceinriktad växeltelefonist med hög ansvarskänsla. I denna roll är du en av de första kontakterna för besökare, medarbetare och externa parter, vilket ställer krav på ett professionellt bemötande, stor noggrannhet och hög integritet. Du kommer att arbeta som konsult, vilket innebär att du är anställd av oss på Manpower men arbetar på plats hos vår kund i Stockholm.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som växeltelefonist är du en viktig del av vår dagliga servicefunktion. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Koppla inkommande samtal till rätt funktion eller medarbetare
* Hänvisa och ta emot besökare i receptionen
* Hjälpa till med lättare IT-ärenden
* Utlämning och mottagning av IT-produkter
* Felanmälningar till interna funktioner eller externa leverantörer
* Påfyllnad och enklare skötsel av kaffemaskiner
* Övriga administrativa och praktiska serviceuppgifter


**Kvalifikationer**
* Fullständig gymnasieexamen
* Minst 6 månaders erfarenhet av roll som receptionist och/eller växeltelefonist
* God datorvana och Microsoft Office
* Erfarenhet av att använda telefonväxlar och hänvisningssystem
* Talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat
* Har du liknande erfarenhet av arbete inom statlig myndighet/universitet eller högskola anses det som meriterande


 För att lyckas i den här rollen ser vi att du är person som är lösningsorienterad med ett starkt sinne för service och bemötande av människor. Du har även en fallenhet för att prioritera arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

**📨 Intresserad?** 
 Skicka in ditt CV. Ditt CV behöver tydligt visa vart du har jobbat samt vilka system du arbetat i. Specificera vilka uppdrag som den efterfrågade erfarenheten har uppnåtts, inklusive tidsperioden i formatet ÅÅ-MM och om det rörde sig om en heltid- eller deltidsanställning.
   

  

**Arbetsplats:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Uppdragslängd:** 
 tom 17 november med chans till förlängning
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
   

  

**Tillträde:** 
 Omgående
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Vid frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Sofia Reideborn via e-post: sofia.reideborn1@manpower.se.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Om Manpower**
 Manpower är Sveriges ledande rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag med tiotusentals attraktiva arbetsgivare över hela landet som våra kunder. Med vårt omfattande nätverk, lokalt såväl som globalt, kan vi erbjuda mängder av spännande lediga jobb som hjälper dig att bygga din karriär, både på kort och lång sikt. Hos oss kan du söka heltidsjobb eller extrajobb vid sidan av studierna. Som konsult hos oss får du en personlig konsultchef som finns där för dig och tillsammans arbetar ni för att du ska utvecklas i din yrkesroll.
   

  

**Erbjudande**
 Rent formellt bygger en anställning hos oss på samma lagar och regler som på den övriga arbetsmarknaden. Vi har kollektivavtal, med allt vad det innebär vad gäller försäkringar, tjänstepension och fackliga relationer. Som konsult erbjuds du även friskvårdsbidrag samt utöver det får alla Manpowers anställda fri tillgång till över ett flertal interaktiva utbildningar via vår e-learningportal PowerYOU.

title: Security Manager - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Är du en person som gillar att arbeta med den senaste tekniken samtidigt som du har erfarenhet av IT-, informations- och cybersäkerhet och vill arbeta för ett av Nordens största företag inom Tech? Då är det här rollen för dig!
   

  

 Vi söker en Security Manager som vill bli en del av Tietoevry Tech Services Consulting i Sverige. Tietoevry Tech Consulting är en multi-molnplattformsleverantör med ett komplett utbud av infrastrukturval i stor skala. Vi driver snabb mjukvaruutveckling och datainnovation med stark säkerhet, skalbarhet, hastighet och besparingar för företag. Tietoevry Tech Consulting tillhandahåller tjänster som skyddar våra kunders digitala tillgångar.
   

  

**I Rollen Som Security Manager Kommer Du Att**
 Som Security Manager arbetar du som konsult och SPOC (Single Point of Contact) gentemot våra kunder och interna tjänsteleveransteam, för alla säkerhetsrelaterade ärenden.
   

  

 Det övergripande målet för en Security Manager är att vara kundens och tjänsteleveransteamets betrodda säkerhetsrådgivare. Du kommer tillhandahålla styrning, rapportering och löpande säkerhetsrådgivning till kunden och hanterar alla säkerhetsrelaterade ämnen inom kunduppdraget.
   

  

 Rollen som Security Manager innebär att ha en ledande roll i Tietoevry Tech Services tjänsteleverans och driva strategiska säkerhetsrelaterade frågor. Uppdraget i en tjänsteleverans innefattar bland annat kontinuerliga riskbedömningar och rådgivning om hur säkerhetsmekanismer kan förbättras. Genom att identifiera avvikelser och förbättringsåtgärder, parallellt med att definiera riktlinjer, processer och strategiska planer, arbetar Security Manager med att kontinuerligt minimera risker och mildra konsekvenser genom att arbeta med ständiga förbättringar inom hela säkerhetsområdet.
   

  

**Vidare Kommer Du**
* Ingå i ett team med erfarna och seniora kollegor. Vi arbetar i nära samarbete och delar kontinuerligt med oss av erfarenheter och kunskaper
* Stötta kund med ditt säkerhetskunnande och ge vägledning inom säkerhetsområdet
* Driva strategiska säkerhetsfrågor och säkerhetsförbättringar
* Utföra säkerhetsgranskningar åt kunder och leveransteamet
* Skapa och/eller sammanställa rapporter och presentera dessa för målgruppen på lämpligt sätt
* Samordna interna säkerhetsexperter för att säkerställa bästa möjliga leveranskvalitet


**Vem Vi Söker**
* Du har flera års arbetslivserfarenhet av IT-, informations- och cybersäkerhet.
* God insyn i en organisations cybersäkerhetsverksamhet och har erfarenhet av att driva strategiska frågor och förbättringsåtgärder inom området.
* Ett genuint intresse för säkerhetsrelaterade teknologier, tjänster och metodiker.
* Hanterar svenska och engelska obehindrat i såväl tal som skrift.


 Med vårt stora kundfokus behöver du också vara serviceinriktad, social, ha en positiv attityd, samt god känsla för detaljer och kvalitet. Du är intresserad av att lära dig nya saker och ser fördelarna med att dela kunskap och erfarenhet.
   

  

**Vi Erbjuder Dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

**Fick vi dig inspirerad?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, Niklas Karlsson, niklas.a.karlsson@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs snart!
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
*Tietoevry värdesätter mångfald och vi välkomnar sökande av alla kön, åldrar, förmågor, etniciteter, inriktningar, övertygelser och bakgrunder.*
 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Senior Mjukvaruingenjör till Coms team
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll**.*


Saab Training & Simulation i Huskvarna söker nu ingenjörer som vill jobba med vår avancerade utrustning! Vi befinner oss just nu i en expansiv fas och därför måste vi stärka teamet med fler duktiga ingenjörer. Du få chansen att lära dig hur våra vapensystem, fordon och simulationsutrustning fungerar. Systemen är omfattande och komplexa vilket innebär att du konstant kommer få lära dig nya saker. Om du vill jobba med den senaste teknologin och inte är rädd för att arbeta med komplicerade system är det här en tjänst för dig!


Din Roll


Du kommer bli del av ett team som präglas av teamkänsla och en härlig dynamik. Du kommer tillhöra avdelningen Embedded Software som består av 80 personer där både juniora och seniora utvecklare, testare och arkitekter arbetar. Vi utvecklare nya delar från början till slut samtidigt som vi förbättrar redan existerande system.


Ditt team kommer främst att vara involverat i att implementera funktioner i C eller C++, systematisera, felsöka och verifiera systemen. Vi jobbar tvärfunktionellt tillsammans med elektronikutvecklare, mjukvaruutvecklare, testare, applikationsingenjörer och teamledare.


Utöver arbete med utveckling av våra system räknar vi med att du också vill bidra med förbättringar av vårt arbetssätt på Saab Training & Simulation.


Din Profil


För att trivas och lyckas i rollen har du:

* En civilingenjörsexamen inom data/elektronik eller motsvarande högskoleingenjörsexamen.
* Flera års erfarenhet som utvecklare (min 3 år)
* Har erfarenhet av C/C++
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Kunskap om Linux och SW applikationer i Linuxbaserade system


Det är meriterande om du har:

* Erfarenheter av GIT och DevOps
* Kunskap om radiokommunikation
* Erfarenheter av Yocto och Buildroot
* Kan göra egna mätningar och enklare felsökning på kortnivå med mätinstrument


Personlighet:

* Har ett starkt teknikintresse och ständigt vill lära dig mer.
* God pedagogisk förmåga för att kunna förmedla dina lösningar och kunskap.
* Du är öppen och ärlig mot medarbetare och våra kunder samt att du litar på andras förmåga och respekterar tagna beslut.
* Ett stort personligt engagemang
* Proaktiv och tar ansvar för tilldelade uppgifter
* Utåtriktad och söker svar inom organisationen
* Gillar att samarbeta med teammedlemmar

*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*


Vad du blir en del av


Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.


Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.


Om du är intresserad av vilka förmåner som du kan ta del av som anställd på Saab i Sverige, kan du läsa om dem här
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Klientspecialist
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll**.*


Din roll:


Vill du arbeta med MDM/MAM som en central del av Saabs Digital Workplace?


Group IT söker nu en klientspecialist som vill bidra till en säker, användarvänlig och effektiv klientplattform för Saab.


I den här rollen blir du en del av vårt team inom Digital Workplace, där vi hanterar klient, telefoner och samarbetslösningar som stödjer Saabs globala verksamhet. Du är prestigelös och van att arbeta i team där man delar med sig av kunskap och tar hjälp av varandra.


Tjänsten är placerad på någon av följande verksamhetsorter: Linköping eller Göteborg. Hybrid arbetsplats är möjlig och resor nationellt samt internationellt kan förekomma. Ditt huvudsakliga ansvar kommer vara hantering av mobila enheter och dess applikationer. Fokus kommer till en början ligga på migrering från en MDM/MAM lösning till en annan.


Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat innefatta att:

* Konfigurera och hantera klientplattformen, så som datorer, telefoner och applikationer.
* Felsöka och åtgärda större problem.
* Arbeta i projekt.
* Säkerställa en stabil och säker drift av plattformen.
* Migrera från en MDM/MAM-lösning till en annan.
* Automatisering.
  

Din profil:


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:

* Senior erfarenhet kring mobila applikationer för både Android och iOS.
* Gedigen erfarenhet inom MDM och MAM (Workspace One, Intune eller liknande).
* Social och kommunikativ förmåga.
* Arbetat i komplexa miljöer där kravuppfyllnad och säkerhet kommer först.
* Är proaktiv och lösningsorienterad som person.
  

Önskvärda färdigheter och erfarenheter:

* En eller flera Microsoft, Google eller AWS-certifieringar.
* Erfarenhet inom DevOps/tvärfunktionella team.
* Erfarenhet av regulatoriska krav eller säkerhetskrav.
*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*

Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.


Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
* 3+ years of experience in DevOps or Cloud Engineering roles.
* Strong experience with Terraform for infrastructure automation, specifically on Azure platform.
* Expertise in managing Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), including configuration, deployment, and scaling.
* Hands-on experience with GitHub Actions to automate workflows and CI/CD pipelines.
* Knowledge of GitOps principles and workflows, with practical experience using ArgoCD for continuous deployment.
* Solid experience in designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines using modern tools and practices.
* Proficient in Git, Docker, and Kubernetes.
* Strong scripting skills in Bash, PowerShell, or Python.
* Familiarity with Azure services such as Azure Functions, App Services, Key Vault, Storage Accounts, and Networking.
* Understanding of cloud security best practices, especially in the context of Kubernetes and Azure cloud environments.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: 450,00kr per day

Experience:

* DevOps: 5 years (Required)
* Azure Kubernetes Service : 3 years (Required)
* Terraform: 3 years (Required)

title: Associate Cloud Operations Architect, EU-North (EMEA)
description:
DESCRIPTION


Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS), and help customers of all industries and sizes gain the best value and service from AWS? Cloud Operations Architects (COA) drive our customers’ creative and transformative spirit of innovation across all technologies - including Compute, Storage, Database, Big Data, Application-level Services, Networking, Serverless, Deployment, Security and more. This is not a sales role, but rather an opportunity to be the principal technical advisor and ‘voice of the customer’ to organizations ranging from start-ups to large enterprises in commercial and public sector.
  

  

The Role  

  

As a Associate COA, you will help craft and execute on defined strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services - including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, CloudFront CDN, IoT, and many more. Your technical appetite to learn and customer-facing skills will enable you to effectively represent AWS within a customer’s environment, and drive customer initiatives working closely with leadership regarding incidents, trade-offs, support, and risk management.  

You will provide advocacy and participate in strategic technical guidance to help customers plan and build solutions using best practices, and proactively keep your customers’ AWS environments operationally healthy. The close relationships developed with your customers will allow you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from AWS. This position will require the ability to travel 10% or more as needed.  

The Associate COA is the centerpiece of value to our Enterprise Support customers. If you wish to be at the forefront of innovation, come join us!  

  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

You’ll advise on solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer  

* Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
* Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
* Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
* Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
* Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
* With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
* Provide detailed reviews of service events, monthly & quarterly metrics, detailed pre-launch planning
* Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud

  

A day in the life  

See what the team say about similar roles;  

  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M7j83fWoqmQ  

  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l48WpOmM5j4  

  

About the team  

Diverse Experiences
  

Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  

  

Why AWS
  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  

  

Work/Life Balance
  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  

  

Inclusive Team Culture
  

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  

  

Mentorship and Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.  

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience in a similar role as a Technical Account Manager, Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect etc. · Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for four (2) of the following: Compute / Storage / Networking / CDN / Databases / DevOps / Big Data and Analytics / Security / Architecture / Applications Development in a distributed systems environment · External customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences · Ability to juggle tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Professional experience with AWS and/or other cloud offerings such as Azure, Google Cloud Platform etc. Programming or scripting skills with a combination of Java, Python Perl, Ruby, C#, and/or PHP Previous experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, Solution Architect, DevOps Engineer, etc. Understanding of DevOps practices and tools, including: Continuous Integration / Deployment, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Chef etc.

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
company_addresses: 440 Terry Ave N, Seattle, WA, United States, Washington

title: Junior DevOps Engineer
description:
Vill du växa inom DevOps och jobba med moderna verktyg och automatiserade plattformar? Nu har du chansen att vara med på en spännande resa, i ett team som jobbar med ny teknik, smarta lösningar och lärande i fokus. Vi söker dig som vill växa i ett erfaret team, arbeta med moderna verktyg och lära dig mer om automatisering och plattformar i en spännande teknisk miljö.
  
  

**Om rollen:**  

Som Junior DevOps Engineer kommer du in i ett kunnigt team som arbetar med drift, säkerhet, automatisering och plattformsutveckling. Vi ser gärna att du har några års erfarenhet av att arbeta praktiskt med IT, som drifttekniker eller liknande och nu är redo att bredda dig inom DevOps-området.
  
Du får stöd och handledning från kollegor med lång erfarenhet, men förväntas också kunna jobba självständigt och ta egna initiativ.
  
**Arbetsuppgifter:** Bidra till utveckling och förvaltning av automatiserade plattformar
  
Hantera drift, felsökning och vidareutveckling av våra miljöer
  
Delta i arbete med CI/CD, infrastruktur som kod och containerlösningar
  
Skriva script och automatisera repetitiva uppgifter
  
Samverka med utvecklare, arkitekter, driftteam och externa leverantörer
  
**Vi ser gärna att du har:** Några års erfarenhet inom IT-drift, teknisk support, serveradministration eller liknande
  
Erfarenhet av Linux eller Windows Server
  
Grundläggande förståelse för nätverk, databaser och felsökning
  
Nyfikenhet på områden som CI/CD, Kubernetes, automatisering och DevOps
  
Förmåga att läsa och skriva enklare script (t.ex. Bash eller Python)
  
Goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
  
**Vår tekniska miljö inkluderar:** Operativsystem & nätverk: Linux, Windows Server, TCP/IP, DNS
  
**Databaser:** SQL, Oracle
  
**CI/CD & automation:** GitLab CI/CD, Ansible, Terraform
  
**Programmering & script:** Python, Bash, Go, Java
  
**Containers & plattformar:** Kubernetes, OpenShift (OKD), Docker
  
**Övervakning & artifact:** Prometheus, ELK, Nexus
  
**IT-säkerhet:** Systemhärdning, nätverks- och hårdvarusäkerhet
  
**Övrigt:** Incidenthantering, felsökning, beställarkontakt
  
  

Uppdraget kräver att du har goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.
  
  

**Om CONSULTING it:**  

När du börjar hos oss som konsult på CONSULTING it blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får dessutom kollegor runt om i Sverige! Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver. Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen – i ditt nästa, nästa och nästa steg. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö!

description:
**Senior DevOps Engineer - .NET + Windows + AWS - English Speaking** 




  





**\*\*Please note, you MUST hold full Swedish residency\*\*** 




  





 This organization specializes in helping students find the right educational opportunities, both locally and internationally. They support individuals looking to pursue full degrees or short-term study experiences abroad, including semesters overseas.
 



  





 They are re-engineering some back office applications and rebuilding some of the environments from scratch, lots to do in the coming years and this person can be hugely influential on how everything gets done and what tools and tech are used.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




 • Design, implement, and continuously improve CI/CD pipelines to automate build, test, and deployment processes.
 



 • Collaborate with distributed development teams to streamline and optimize development workflows. Grow and upskill the teams and reduce their dependency on the DevOps team
 



 • Build, optimize and continuously improve our production environments, fostering automation, proactiveness and self-healing. The focus will be their Linux-based environments
 



 • Implement monitoring and alerting solutions to ensure the health and performance of production systems.
 



 • Manage and configure our cloud infrastructure.
 



 • Implement best practices for security, compliance, and disaster recovery.
 



 • Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure-related issues in production and development environments
 



  





**Experience required:**

title: Senior DevOps (Full remote)
description:
**Job Description**
**Location:** 
 Fully remote, EU timezone (CET ±2 hours)
   

  

**Start date:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Languages:** 
 Fluent English is mandatory
   

  

**Industry:** 
 Cloud Computing / Web3 / AI – European SaaS
   

  

 We are hiring at
 **Pragmatike** 
 to expand our team and drive the growth of our internal projects.
   

  

 Our focus is on developing cutting-edge solutions in
 **Cloud Computing** 
 ,
 **Blockchain** 
 , and
 **Artificial Intelligence** 
 , while fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation. Joining us means being part of a passionate team where your ideas and skills directly contribute to shaping tomorrow’s technologies.
   

  

 If you're excited about working on ambitious projects in a dynamic and flexible environment, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

**Position:**
 We’re expanding our infrastructure and looking for a
 **DevOps engineer** 
 to help us build a secure, scalable, and automated foundation for our distributed systems.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll design and implement tools for
 **monitoring, automation,** 
 and
 **resource coordination** 
 across multiple remote environments. You'll also help define
 **security policies** 
 and ensure smooth, compliant operations across our infrastructure.
   

  

 Your contribution will be central to maintaining a resilient, high-performing platform, using modern DevOps practices and technologies like
 **Linux** 
 ,
 **Ansible** 
 ,
 **PXE** 
 ,
 **OpenStack** 
 , and
 **Proxmox** 
 .
   

  

 If you’re autonomous, thrive in agile setups, and want to work on challenging infrastructure problems at scale, we’d love to connect.
   

  

**Your
 **Responsabilities:****
* Conceive and implement a system to monitor the health of all infrastructure instances and optimize the usage of idle resources.
* Develop and maintain internal tools and web-based dashboards to track infrastructure performance.
* Monitor a wide range of systems including servers, operating systems, networking gear, and physical infrastructure like PDUs, cooling units, UPS, and alarm systems.
* Define and maintain documentation for security policies, monitoring protocols, and compliance requirements.
* Automate system deployment and daily operations using Ansible, PXE boot, and Python scripts.
* Provide expert support and troubleshooting for Linux environments and virtualization platforms.
* Build automation processes to manage compute and storage resources across multiple sites using platforms like OpenStack, Proxmox, and VMware.
* Contribute to infrastructure scaling efforts to support expansion to over 100 distributed sites.
* Work closely with product teams, manufacturing, and on-site deployment crews to ensure consistent operational standards and tooling.


**What You Bring:**
* Solid background in DevOps or SysOps, with strong emphasis on automation and internal tooling.
* Deep understanding of Linux systems, along with proficiency in scripting and infrastructure management.
* Hands-on experience with Ansible, MongoDB, and building or maintaining CI/CD pipelines.
* Ability to produce clear, structured documentation for security, operational processes, and infrastructure standards.
* Comfortable working in a remote-first, fast-moving environment with a high degree of autonomy.


**Nice To Have**
* Hands-on experience with Unifi network devices or similar technologies.
* Experience managing multi-site or distributed infrastructures.
* Proficiency with OpenStack, Proxmox, VMware, and provisioning tools like PXE.


**Why Join Us:**
 A European
 **tech startup** 
 on a mission to reinvent
 **cloud infrastructure** 
 through decentralization. By combining
 **modular data center architecture** 
 with advanced
 **automation** 
 , the goal is to deliver a
 **sovereign** 
 ,
 **energy** 
 -
 **efficient** 
 , and
 **high** 
 -
 **performance** 
 alternative to traditional cloud providers.
   

  

 Expect a
 **dynamic, challenge-driven** 
 work environment where autonomy and problem-solving are encouraged. Every contribution has a
 **direct impact** 
 on the success of a bold and forward-thinking project.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Är du en erfaren DevOps-ingenjör med intresse för teknik och att ständigt utvecklas? Vill du hjälpa våra kunder att göra världen lite bättre? Då kan du vara den vi söker.
   

  

 HiQ är utan tvekan ett av Sveriges mest tekniktunga och spännande konsultbolag med kunder inom en rad olika branscher såsom exempelvis fordon, fintech, myndigheter, medtech och telekom. Förutom att vi bidragit till utvecklingen av att snart bli ett kontantlöst samhälle, utvecklar vi även allt från digitaliseringen av elkraftsystem till framtidens autonoma fordon. Enkelt sagt, vi gillar att skapa sådant som förenklar och gör vardagen lite roligare för oss alla.
   

  

 Rollen som DevOps-ingenjör hos oss är en omväxlande roll, med arbete på olika nivåer, där du får en chans att delta i våra kunders DevOps-resa utifrån deras mognadsgrad.
   

  

**Matchar vi?**
 Vi söker dig som blir uttråkad av att göra samma sak två gånger och genast börjar hacka ihop en automatiserad lösning istället. Vi ser gärna att du har automatiserat något som absolut inte behövdes automatiseras! Kanske hemma?
   

  

 De som jobbar med DevOps på HiQ har ofta en kodtung utbildning och har jobbat som DevOps engineer i några år. Vi ser gärna att du har en liknande bakgrund, då vi oftast tar oss an Stockholms mer avancerade uppdrag.
   

  

**Checklist**
* Högskole-/Universitetsexamen inom datateknik, datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller annan relevant inriktning
* Minst 3 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Flytande i svenska och engelska


 Det är ett stort plus om du har tidigare erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Scripting
* Säkerhet
* Monitorering
* CI/CD-tekniker
* Containeriseringsverktyg och molnlösningar
* Automation i produktionsmiljö med många noder
* IP-nätverk, VPN, DNS, lastbalanserare och brandväggar
* Seamless/automatiserade byggscript för release management i olika miljöer


 Vi ser också gärna att du tidigare byggt sofistikerad infrastruktur med en hög grad av automation och är en förespråkare av infrastructure-as-code.

title: Release Coordinator
description:
Coalesce Management Consultancy (CMC) has a consulting assignment available for an experienced
 **Release Coordinator** 
 to lead and manage our software release and change management processes. This role bridges software delivery, change control, and stakeholder engagement to ensure that software releases are aligned, well-documented, and continuously improving.
 



  





 This is a hybrid role requiring both technical acumen in software development processes and strong organizational and stakeholder management skills.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Coordinate and manage software releases across multiple teams and systems.
* Own and drive the
 **Software and Systems Release (SSR)** 
 process.
* Perform administrative and coordination tasks related to change and release management.
* Lead change management activities across projects, ensuring that releases are properly planned, documented, and communicated.
* Drive continuous improvements in the release and change management processes.
* Develop and implement
 **clear, repeatable processes** 
 for release and change, including templates and best practices.
* Support and coach system owners on how to follow the release process effectively.
* Collaborate closely with software architects, developers, product owners, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment.
* Establish and maintain strong documentation and traceability for release cycles.
* Ensure architectural clarity and consistency throughout the release planning and execution.
* Serve as a key liaison between engineering teams and business stakeholders regarding release schedules and risks.



  





**Qualifications & Experience** 




  




* **5–10 years of experience** 
 in software release coordination, change management, or related fields.
* Proven experience working in environments with complex software architecture.
* Solid understanding of software development lifecycles (SDLC), particularly in embedded, automotive, or enterprise software.
* Experience coordinating releases across multiple teams and stakeholders.
* Strong skills in stakeholder communication, process facilitation, and issue resolution.
* Familiarity with release/change management tools (e.g., Jira, Azure DevOps, Git, Jenkins).
* Experience driving process improvements and managing documentation and administrative tasks at scale.



  





  





**All engineers must be currently living in Sweden - other wise you will not be considered for this role.** 




  





 You would be able to operate as an independent consultant for this assignment, which I can support with. If you are not available for a new project now, we offer a generous referral scheme. If this assignment is of interest to you. To speed up your application, when replying please provide an up-to-date copy of your CV along with your contact information. If you do not currently live and work in Sweden you will not be considered for this role.
 



  






 Get in touch
 




  





 Learn more about Coalesce Management Consulting, our projects, and the support we provide to our consultants at https://expertisedelivered.com
 



  





 No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

title: System Engineer
description:
!!! IMPORTANT !!!
 



 Please do not apply, but contact me if you have not answered YES to ALL the screening questions!
 



 !!! IMPORTANT !!!
 



  





 Cikoria Embedded continues to grow and we are looking for system engineers.
 



 We have customers in all branches and you can expect assignments in anything from MedTech to autonomous vehicles. We carry out our assignments both in-house and at our customers. As we are a growing company, we also welcome you to explore other roles within the organization such as engineering manager or in sales.
 



 We have modern offices at Fridhemsplan, although most of us work remotely at the moment.
 



**About you** 




 We expect the following from you as a colleague:
 



 • We expect you to have a very high level of integrity. You will tell your boss (or the customer for that matter) if you think they are wrong.
 



 • We expect you to take pride in your work. You understand that your reputation (and ours) depends on a high-quality delivery every time.
 



 • We don't expect you to be an excellent communicator, but we do expect you to try. You understand that by talking to your customer, you reduce more project risks than anything else.
 



 • You speak and write both Swedish and English fluently.
 



**Qualifications** 




 You have several years of experience working as a system engineer or system architect, preferably in the embedded domain. You have experience working with safety-critical systems and/or cyber security. You have a master's degree or equivalent.
 



 Experience in the following areas is advantageous:
 



 · Software or hardware engineering
 



 · Requirement management
 



 · System Architecture
 



 · Troubleshooting/problem solving
 



 · Safety-critical and/or cybersecurity-related applications such as automotive, MedTech, rail, etc.
 



 · ISO/IEC/SAE-standards like 26262, 21434, 13489, 62304, 13485, 61508, 62443
 



 We look forward to your application!
 



  





 About Cikoria Embedded
 



 We are a young engineering company filled with senior engineers and we are building Sweden's leading consulting company in safety-critical embedded systems. We have modern offices in Stockholm City (Fridhemsplan). Our management system has been ISO 9001, 14001 and 27001 certified.
 



  





 !!! IMPORTANT !!!
 



 Please do not apply, but contact me if you have not answered YES to ALL the screening questions!
 



 !!! IMPORTANT !!!

title: iOS Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* 5+ years of professional experience in iOS development, with a strong command of Swift and Objective-C.
* Familiar with iOS SDK and various frameworks like UIKit (CoreData, CoreGraphics are plus) and understand how to leverage them effectively to build robust iOS applications.
* Proficiency with modern concurrency paradigms like Combine and Structured Concurrency
* Understanding of common architectural patterns such as MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel)
* Proficiency with version control systems like Git
* Experience in working with RESTful APIs, JSON parsing, and data serialisation formats like Protobuf
* Strong debugging skills to identify and fix bugs, memory leaks, and other issues
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools like Jenkins or Fastlane to streamline the build, test, and deployment process.
* Commitment to writing clean, maintainable code with a focus on code quality, and experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing


**Application deadline: 30-06-2025**
**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Vår kund är en väletablerad aktör inom försäkring, pension och finansiell rådgivning med verksamhet i Norden och Europa. Företagets Data-team har i uppgift att förse organisationens olika enheter med dataunderlag, analyser och insikter för att rätt beslut ska kunna fattas varje dag. Teamet bygger och förvaltar en central dataplattform och BI-infrastruktur, som är kärnan i bolagets växande kultur av datadrivet beslutsfattande.
 



  





 Som Senior Data Engineer tillhör du ett litet men erfaret team som ansvarar för koncernens centrala BI-plattform. Rollen innebär stort eget ansvar och omfattar såväl teknisk utveckling som nära samarbete med verksamheten för att leverera lösningar som skapar värde.
 



  





 Du kommer vara stationerad i moderna lokaler i centrala Stockholm (hybridmodell), och samarbetar dagligen med representanter från en rad olika team i verksamheten.
 



  





 I rollen får du bland annat chansen att:
 


* Utveckla och förvalta pipelines för dataorkestrering i Azure Data Factory
* Skapa och underhålla SQL/Python-notebooks i Azure Databricks
* Administrera och modellera koncernens Data Warehouse i Azure Synapse
* Designa semantiska modeller och rapporter i Power BI/Fabric
* Implementera API-integrationer via Azure Functions och Python
* Föra dialog med verksamheten för att kartlägga behov och leverera pragmatiska lösningar



  





 Kvalifikationer
 


* Minst 4 års erfarenhet som Data Engineer, Data Analyst, BI Developer eller liknande
* Mycket goda kunskaper i SQL och erfarenhet av Python
* Erfarenhet av databasmodellering (t.ex. Kimball eller Data Vault)
* Erfarenhet av OLAP-lösningar och semantiska modeller i Power BI eller SSAS
* Flytande svenska och god engelska i tal och skrift



  





 Meriterande kvalifikationer
 


* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure-techstack (ADF, Databricks, Synapse, Functions)
* Tidigare arbete i finans- eller försäkringsbransch
* Kunskap om tömmande av API:er och Containerization (Docker)



  





 Skicka in din ansökan eller kontakta oss direkt för att höra mer – vi ser fram emot att prata med dig!

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
**Job Description** 




  





**Role Overview:** 
 We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Network Automation Engineer to be a part of our automating network journey. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, leadership, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively. If you are passionate about network automation and have a proven track record in this field, we want to hear from you!
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 
 Design, develop, and implement network automation solutions using Python and Ansible. Manage and maintain Linux-based systems. Apply DevOps principles to streamline workflows, including CI/CD processes. Oversee software development processes, including testing, code analysis, and release management. Lead network automation initiatives with a focus on routing, switching, and working with Cisco and Aruba technologies. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive projects to completion. Independently manage development tasks and initiatives, even in the absence of clear direction.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 




 Senior-level proficiency in Python.
 



 Experience with Ansible. Experience with Linux system.
 



 Proven DevOps experience, including CI/CD workflows.
 



 Solid understanding of software development processes and best practices.
 



 4-5 years of experience in network automation.
 



 Expertise in network engineering, particularly with routing, switching, and Cisco/Aruba technologies.
 



 Ability to work effectively both as part of a team and independently.

title: AI Engineer - [F/M/X]
description:
Who are we?
   

  

**Amaris Consulting** 
 is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.
   

  

 At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
   

  

**Brief Call** 
 : Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
   

  

**Interviews** 
 (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
   

  

**Case study** 
 : Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
   

  

 As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
   

  

 We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Job Description**
**Core Responsibilities**
* Design and optimize AI systems (traditional ML + GenAI/LLMs) for production
* Build scalable AI infrastructure (GPU-optimized frameworks, MLOps pipelines)
* Implement LLM solutions (OpenAI, Claude, RAG, vector DBs) in real-world applications
* Collaborate with research/product teams to bridge innovation↔production gaps
* Maintain CI/CD/MLOps standards (testing, profiling, documentation)
* Track and apply cutting-edge AI advancements (e.g., transformer optimizations)


**Technical Requirements**
**Must-Have:**
* Python/C++ (production-grade) | PyTorch/TensorFlow
* GPU/HPC: CUDA/HIP, Spark, or distributed computing
* Cloud AI: Azure/AWS/GCP deployment experience
* LLM Stack: API integration, RAG, vector databases (e.g., Pinecone)
* MLOps: Git, CI/CD, model monitoring


**Nice-to-Have:**
* Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
* Microservices & REST APIs
* Visualization (Power BI)
* Research-to-production transition experience


**Profile**
**Education:**
* PhD/MSc in CS, AI, or related field


**Experience:**
* 3–8+ years in AI engineering (or strong PhD research in transformers)


**Soft Skills:**
* Fluent English | Collaborative | Pragmatic innovator


*Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.*
